a.text: 这是一种彻底的“蒙蔽”。教练的行为（“什么都不说”）完全符合Level 9描述中“隐瞒利益冲突（蒙蔽）”的定义。教练单方面决定“切割开”并隐瞒信息，完全剥夺了客户的知情权，这是对客户最严重的“蒙蔽”行为。

b.text: 这是一种“延迟披露”式的“蒙蔽”。教练已经有了合理的怀疑，但选择了不透明的回应（“听着有点熟”）。这依然属于Level 9中“隐瞒利益冲突（蒙蔽）”的范畴。教练没有在第一时间坦诚，而是为了自己“确认”而选择拖延，这同样是对客户的“蒙蔽”。

c.text: 这是一种“有条件的”的“蒙蔽”。这仍然是Level 9中“隐瞒利益冲突（蒙蔽）”的一种。教练让客户在信息不全的情况下做出了“来找自己”的决定。这种行为利用了信息差，是对客户的“蒙蔽”，客户在建立关系*之前*就有权知道全部信息。

d.text: 这是Level 9（蒙蔽）的完全反面，是最负责任的行动。此行动在9级框架中，最接近Level 3 (看见处境)。Level 3的核心是“就事论事地表达了看见和理解”。在这里，教练“看见”了整个*专业处境*的严重性，并通过“直接说明”这一坦诚行为，表达了对客户处境和知情权的“看见”与“尊重”。

options.text: 什么都不说，尽量把自己作为竞争公司投资人的身份，与教练身份“切割开”。
只是说“这名字听着有点熟”，并在心里记一下，打算晚上再确认它是不是竞争对手。
只有当这位潜在来访者之后真的来找自己做教练时，才说明自己有竞争公司投资人这个身份。
直接说明自己是竞争公司投资人，并坦诚这可能会形成利益冲突。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：D(3) - C(9) - B(9) - A(9)

本题考察的是9级框架中 Level 9 (指责、蒙蔽、出卖) 的鉴别能力，特别是关于“利益冲突”的“蒙蔽”行为。ACB选项本质上都是对客户的“蒙蔽”：C是“有条件的蒙蔽”，B是“拖延式的蒙蔽”，而A是“完全的蒙蔽”。而最为差劲是A，因为它代表了教练在明知冲突的情况下，做出了一个完全不透明、彻底隐瞒的决定，这是对客户知情权最严重的践踏。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当教练“直接说明”（D）时，我（客户）虽然可能失望，但我会感到被尊重和安全，我看到的是一个诚信、透明、把我的利益放在首位的专业人士，这反而建立和巩固了信任。相反，如果我（客户）事后发现教练早就知道但没说（A）、拖延了（B）或是等我签约了才说（C），我会感到被欺骗、被蒙蔽，甚至是被背叛。这三个选项中，A选项（完全不说）给客户带来的被欺骗感和不安全感是最强烈的，因此A是“最差行动”。
title: (ICF官方样题1)一位教练正在和一名正在创业的潜在来访者见面。两人很快建立了轻松的沟通，教练也对合作机会感到兴奋。临近谈话结束时，这位潜在来访者顺口提到了自己新公司的名字。教练一听就觉得眼熟——因为教练本人是同一社区里一家更成熟、而且是竞争关系的公司的投资人。此时，教练应该怎么做？最好的、最差的选项是哪项？

options.text: 立刻回顾上一次对话，找自己哪里做得不够，思考本可以怎么支持来访者更好地落实计划。
先深呼吸一下，并承认：是否落实计划，这是来访者自己的选择与责任。
先把失望情绪放一边，专注于这一次对话；并决定把这次情况留到之后向导师教练（督导）反思请教。
先表扬来访者按期完成了项目，但同时追问：为什么没有支持团队成员的成长？

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：B(2/3) - C(3) - A(5) - D(9)

本题考察的是教练在“期望落空”和“感到失望”时，如何管理自己的情绪和议程，以保持客户为中心。最佳行动（B）是教练最根本的思维转变，即通过“深呼吸”（Level 2）来“承认客户的责任”（Level 3），这能让教练立刻放下自己的情绪和议程。C是Level 3的应用，A是Level 5，教练失焦了。而D选项是最为差劲的，教练的失望导致他做出了Level 9 (指责) 的行为，“为什么没有...”是对客户选择的公然评判。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）说“我还是自己做了”时，如果教练（D）反问我“为什么不...”，我会立刻感到被指责和评判，我下次再也不敢说真话了。如果教练（A）走神了，我会感到被忽视。而教练（B）“深呼吸”并“承认”，这可能会让我（客户）瞬间察觉到教练的失望，但紧随其后的“这是你的选择与责任”反而是一种高度的坦诚。这种坦诚没有指责我，而是把议题的核心（我的选择）交还给了我，让我感到被尊重，并引导我（客户）去思考“我为什么会这样选”，这是最好的行动。
title: (ICF官方样题2)来访者在工作中很难把任务分派给团队成员。上一次对话里，他提到自己负责的一个重要项目进度落后，教练也帮他一起想了把任务下放的策略。到下一次对话时，来访者说：“最后我还是把所有任务都自己做了，这样才能按时完成。”教练对此感到失望：来访者并没有落实上次制定的分派计划。教练现在应该怎么做？请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 5 (聚焦过去事物)。这是教练在“失焦”的表现。

解析：教练的失望导致他没有“在场”，而是立刻陷入了对自己的反思和对过去（上一次对话）的复盘。这符合Level 5的定义，即“将对话议程引向过去发生的事情”。这个行动是“以教练为中心”的，教练在担心自己的表现，而不是在此刻服务于客户当下的议程。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 2 (看见情绪) / Level 3 (看见处境)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练思维的核心动作。面对“失望”（教练自己的情绪），教练首先要管理好自己（“深呼吸”，这是Level 2“看见情绪”的开始），然后立刻重新校准“客户为中心”的立场，即“承认这是来访者自己的选择与责任”（这是Level 3“看见处境”）。这个内部的思维转变是所有“最佳行动”的必要前提，它能让教练放下自己的议程。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 3 (看见处境)。这是一个很好的行动，但不是“最佳”。

解析：教练“把失望情绪放一边”是一种对情绪的*压制*或*忽略*，并没有真正做到Level 2的“看见情绪”。但教练强行“专注于这一次对话”，这是在努力做到Level 3（看见客户的处境），即跟随客户当下的议程。这是一个专业且正确的“应用”层面的动作，但它不如B选项（从根本上重置思维）来得更核心。

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 9 (指责、蒙蔽、出卖)。这是“一票否决”的最差选项。

解析：“表扬”是虚假的，只是为了引出后面的“追问”。“为什么没有...”是一种典型的、带有评判性的“指责”。这完全符合Level 9的定义。教练把自己的失望（“你没按计划做”）和自己的议程（“团队成长”）强加给客户，这完全违背了“客户是自己选择的主体”这一原则。

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 3 (看见处境)。这是一个很好的、支持性的行动。

解析：教练敏锐地观察到客户“压力很大”的状态，并提出“先缓一缓”的邀请。这个行动的核心是Level 3 (看见处境)，教练“看见”了客户当下的处境（即客户的状态不适合立即开始深入对话），并就这个“处境”本身提出了一个专业、关怀的选择。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 5 (聚焦过去事物) / Level 6 (给予方向建议)。

解析：客户以“慌乱的方式”列出了三件并列的事情，而教练在此时单方面替客户选择了议题（“年迈父母”）。这使得议程在一定程度上被教练主导，属于Level 6 (给予方向建议)的行为。同时，教练在客户尚未明确目标时，就将议程引向一个具体（且非未来导向）的事物，这也涉及了Level 5的特征。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索) / Level 2 (看见情绪) / Level 3 (看见处境)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练的典范行动。首先，教练“确认...三个挑战”，是“看见了客户的处境”（Level 3），这个复述的动作本身就能缓解客户的“慌乱”感（Level 2 看见情绪）。然后，教练通过“询问...从哪一个开始探索”，这是Level 1 (赋能探索)的核心，将选择权和主导权交还给客户，与客户合作，共同确立议程。

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 6 (给予方向建议)。这是“一票否决”的最差选项。

解析：这和B选项一样，是教练在主导议程，但情况更糟。教练同样在Level 6 (给予方向建议)上替客户做了决定。而他做决定的理由（“因为这是首先提到的”）是一个完全“以教练为中心”的、武断的规则，它完全忽略了客户当下的优先级和感受，是教练在强加自己的逻辑。

options.text: 询问来访者是否需要在开始教练对话前先缓一缓，因为他们看起来压力很大。
请来访者进一步分享关于其年迈父母的情况。
确认来访者刚刚分享了三个重要挑战，并询问他们希望先从哪一个开始探索。
让来访者先从他们在工作中筹办的重大活动开始，因为这是他们首先提到的。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：C(1/2/3) - A(3) - B(5/6) - D(6)

本题考察的是教练在客户“慌乱”并抛出多个议程时，如何建立对话焦点。最佳行动（C）是PCC教练的典范，它通过“确认”（Level 3）和“询问”（Level 1 赋能探索）来与客户合作，这同时也回应了客户的慌乱情绪（Level 2）。A选项（Level 3）也是一个很好的关怀，但C更进一步。而B和D选项都是Level 6（给予方向建议），教练在主导议程，这是“最差”的行为。D选项因为附加了一个武断的、以教练为中心的规则，比B更差。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）“慌乱”地抛出三件事时，如果教练（C）能清晰地帮我复述这三件事，并让我自己选一个，我会立刻感到被理解、被赋能，混乱感也会随之降低。如果教练（A）让我缓一缓，我也会感到被关怀。但如果教练（B或D）直接挑一个让我开始说，我会感到我的另外两个问题被无视了，而且是教练在“推着我走”。D选项（因为我先说就必须先谈）给我的感觉最糟糕，因为它最武断，完全不关心我*现在*最想谈的是什么。因此C是“最佳行动”，D是“最差行动”。
title:
(ICF样题3)来访者在本次对话开始时看起来压力很大。教练问来访者想谈些什么时，来访者以一种有些慌乱的方式，先后列出三件事：他们在工作中正在筹办的一场重大活动、他们在组织的一次大型家庭聚会、以及照料年迈父母的责任。
问题：教练应该怎么做？
请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 2 (看见情绪) / Level 3 (看见处境)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是一个专业且平衡的PCC级别行动。首先，教练“承认...反思工作”，这是Level 3 (看见处境)，接住了客户的努力。然后，教练使用了关键的赋能词：“询问...是否愿意”。这把控制权交还给了客户。教练看见了日记的核心（Level 2 看见情绪/焦虑），并*邀请*客户去触碰这个核心议题，同时给了客户安全退出的权利。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 5 (聚焦过去事物) / Level 6 (给予方向建议)。这是一个不佳的行动。

解析：这是教练“以教练为中心”的表现。客户（一个分析型的人）鼓起勇气分享了详细的书面反思，而教练的回应（“给我总结”）是要求客户为教练的便利服务。这符合Level 5的定义（聚焦过去事物），同时也构成了Level 6（给予流程上的建议），在一定程度上主导了客户的行动。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 6 (给予方向建议) / Level 7 (主导具体方案)。这是“最差选项”。

解析：客户刚刚分享了他“深刻的反思”和“焦虑”（Level 2/3，关于“人”），客户当下的议程是“被看见”。此选项忽略了客户的分享，直接跳到“事情”（“采取步骤”）。这是一种Level 4 (聚焦未来事物)的严重错位，教练在强行主导议程（“我们该解决问题了”），这已经构成了Level 6/7的行为。这种对客户议程的*主动偏离*，使其成为最差的选项。

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索)。这是一个非常好的、安全的选择，但不是“最佳”。

解析：这个行动尊重了客户的方式（“日记过程”），并提出了一个关于“人”的问题（“新的认识”），这完全符合Level 1（赋能探索）的定义。但这个提问缺乏必要的承接。它跳过了客户当下最需要被“看见”的*核心内容*（焦虑/情绪），直接去问*结果*（认识），客户可能会感到教练没有“接住”他们分享的感受。A选项（先接住感受）是D选项（探索认识）的必要前提。

options.text: 承认来访者所做的反思工作，并询问来访者是否愿意探索他们在日记中描述的一些情绪。
询问来访者是否会为教练总结他们在日记中详述的条目。
要求来访者确定他们可以采取的一些步骤来克服他们所写的焦虑。
询问来访者他们通过日记过程对自己产生了什么新的认识。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：A(2/3) - D(1) - B(5/6) - C(6/7)

本题考察的是教练如何处理分析型客户的“脆弱分享”。最佳行动（A）是PCC的典范，教练既“看见”了日记的核心（Level 2 焦虑），又通过“询问你是否愿意”交还了权力，在尊重边界的前提下勇敢地触碰核心，这比D选项（Level 1）的“跳跃式”提问更具承接性。B选项（Level 5/6）是一个以教练为中心的不佳行为。而C选项（要求步骤）是最为差劲的，它主动无视了客户的“反思”和“焦虑”议程，强行把一个“Level 2/3”的分享时刻，扭转为“Level 6/7”的“解决问题”议程，这是对客户当下状态最大的“不看见”。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）鼓起勇气把日记给你时，我最希望你“看见”我的“反思”和“焦虑”。如果教练（C）马上让我“想办法”，我会感到被忽视。如果教练（B）让我“总结”，我会感到被轻视。如果教练（D）问我“有什么认识”，我感到被尊重了，但有点“隔靴搔痒”。但如果教练（A）既“承认”我的努力，又“温柔地问我是否愿意”谈谈我的感受，我（客户）会感到被*真正地*看见了，并且我是安全的。因此A是“最佳行动”，C是“最差行动”。
title:
(ICF样题4) 一位大学生物医学研究人员正在与一位教练合作，以改善他们与同事的互动。来访者是一个非常分析型的思考者，可以很容易地解释详细的数据点和复杂的图表，但似乎不愿与教练分享任何私人的东西。在之前的会话中，教练鼓励来访者描述他们在社交活动中的感受，但来访者似乎非常不舒服，只用简短的、单词的回答。当来访者今天来到他们的会话时，来访者默默地递给教练一本。在过去的一周里，来访者写了几篇详细的条目，讲述了他们自上次会话以来参加大学午餐会、教师聚会和员工发展研讨会的经历。虽然来访者目前对教练说的很少，但他们的条目显示了对来访者在这些事件中所经历的焦虑的深刻反思，以及他们克服社交焦虑的愿望。教练应该怎么做？
请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

一位教练最近开始与一位来访者合作，帮助他们规划退休生活。该来访者是一位备受尊敬的教师，已在当地一所小学任教30年。来访者在教练会话中始终准备充分、条理清晰，在会话之间会定期报告进展，并确定在教练对话中要关注的具体主题。来访者表示他们期待退休，但他们总是以一种非常就事论事的方式讨论退休计划。在本次会话中，来访者分享说他们还有两周就要退休了。他们希望专注于讨论一些还需要制定的剩余计划。突然，来访者开始哭泣，并说道：“我大半辈子都在这所学校度过！我爱我的学生，我的同事是我最好的朋友。我无法想象，当我每天早上不再走进学校大门时，我的生活会是什么样子！”
教练应该怎么做？
请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索) / Level 2 (看见情绪)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练的典范行动。首先，“停顿”和“承认情绪影响”完美地“接住”了客户当下的状态，这是Level 2 (看见情绪)。然后，教练通过“询问...是否愿意”将选择权交还给客户，这体现了Level 1 (赋能探索)的核心要求。

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务) / Level 6 (给予方向建议)。这是“最差选项”。

解析：在客户哭泣并分享深刻个人感受的时刻，教练的这个行动（“请...确定...剩余计划”）是强行主导议程。这属于Level 6 (给予方向建议)的范畴，因为它暗示客户“你应该谈计划”。同时，它也是Level 4 (聚焦未来事务)，因为它无视了当下的情绪，强行将对话引向了“事务”议程。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务)。

解析：教练确实“看见”了客户的强烈情绪（Level 2），但教练对这个情绪的*回应*是Level 4。教练没有停留在当下的感受上，而是立即将对话引向一个重大的“未来事务”（即退休决策）。这个提问跳过了客户当下的失落感，属于Level 4的范畴。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 3 (看见处境)。

解析：这是一个Level 3的“看见”。教练没有像D一样“看见”客户的*独特*情绪（Level 2），而是“看见”了客户所处的*普遍*处境（“退休是大事”），并对此进行了“正常化”的回应。这至少“接住”了客户的话题（退休转折），是一个支持性的行为。

options.text: 停顿一下，然后请来访者确定他们今天希望关注的剩余计划。
询问来访者是否确定自己真的想退休。
承认退休是一个重大的人生转折，有情绪反应是正常的。
停顿一下，然后承认这个转折似乎给来访者带来的情绪影响，并询问他们是否愿意花一些时间来感受这些情绪。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：D(1/2) - C(3) - B(4) - A(4/6)

本题考察的是教练在客户表达强烈情绪时的应对能力。最佳行动（D）是PCC的典范，它通过Level 2“看见情绪”和Level 1“赋能探索”完美地承接了客户的脆弱分享。C选项（Level 3）是“看见处境”。B选项（Level 4）虽然“看见”了情绪，但用“聚焦未来事务”的方式错误地回应了情绪。而A选项（Level 4/6）是**最为差劲**的，它不仅像B一样“聚焦未来事务”，还叠加了Level 6的主导议程，这是对客户当下状态最严重的“不看见”。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）突然崩溃哭泣时，我最需要的是被“接住”。如果教练（D）能“看见”我的情绪并“温柔地询问”，我会感到无比安全和被尊重。如果教练（C）告诉我“这很正常”，我会觉得被泛化了，但至少被理解了。现在我们来比较A和B，两者都偏离了当下的情绪，都涉及Level 4（聚焦未来事务），但感受是不同的：当教练（B）质疑我的决定时，我（客户）会感到他们没在听我的感受，但至少他们*回应*了我的话。但如果教练（A）在我哭泣后，*完全无视*我的眼泪，问我“我们来谈谈接下来的计划吧”，我会感到被彻底地无视和否定，因为他们连我的情绪*存在本身*都忽略了。这是最差的体验。因此D是“最佳行动”，A是“最差行动”。

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 6 (给予方向建议)。这是“最差选项”。

解析：客户的沉默和表情变化是重要的数据，表明客户有强烈的情绪反应。教练此时“重复问题”是忽略了客户的情绪。这属于Level 6的范畴，因为根据我们的定义，教练在“强行引导议题”（暗示“你必须回答我这个问题”），而不是去探索客户的沉默。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 3 (看见处境)。

解析：教练观察到了客户的反应，并提供了一个程序性的选择（“需要休息吗”）。这是一个Level 3 (看见处境)的支持性行为。它“看见”了客户的处境（不适），但没有像C选项那样直接去“看见”客户的情绪本身，是一个较为表层的回应。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索) / Level 2 (看见情绪)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练的典范行动。教练“停顿”，然后“承认...能量变化”，这是Level 2 (看见情绪)。接着，教练通过“询问...是否愿意”将选择权交还给客户，这体现了Level 1 (赋能探索)的核心。教练完美地“接住”了客户的非语言信息，并赋能客户去选择是否探索。

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务) / Level 5 (聚焦过去事务)。

解析：客户刚刚表现出强烈的情绪反应（笑容消失、沉默）。教练此举（“邀请...探索...特征”）完全忽略了客户当下的状态，强行回到了之前的“事务”话题。这既是Level 5（聚焦客户过去列出的特征），也是Level 4（聚焦未来的事务），是一种对客户当下情绪的“不看见”。

options.text: 向来访者重复这个问题，给他们另一次机会来回应教练的询问。
询问来访者是否可以继续进行会话，或者他们是否需要休息一下。
停顿一下，然后与来访者分享他们注意到来访者的能量发生了变化。询问来访者是否愿意探索他们此刻的感受。
邀请来访者探索他们为新工作所列出的每一个特征，以支持来访者权衡他们收到的录用通知。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：C(1/2) - B(3) - D(4/5) - A(6)

本题考察的是教练在客户因教练的提问而产生强烈情绪转变时的应对能力。最佳行动（C）是PCC的典范，它通过Level 2“看见情绪”和Level 1“赋能探索”完美地承接了客户的非语言信息。B选项（Level 3）是一个支持性的关怀。D选项（Level 4/5）通过忽略情绪、退回“事务”议程来回避。而A选项（Level 6）是最为差劲的，它不仅没有“看见”客户的沉默，反而属于Level 6中“强行引导议题”的行为，通过“重复问题”的方式给客户施加了压力。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）因为教练的提问（关于家人）而笑容消失并沉默时，我最需要的是被“接住”。如果教练（C）能“看见”我的能量变化并“温柔地询问”我，我会感到无比安全和被尊重。如果教练（B）问我是否需要休息，我也会感到被关怀。但如果教练（D）完全无视我的沉默，转而谈论工作，我会感到被忽视。但最差的是（A），当教练“重复”那个让我不适的问题时，我会感到被逼迫和不安全，这是一种侵入性的行为。因此C是“最佳行动”，A是“最差行动”。
title:
(ICF样题6) 一位来访者正在与一位教练合作，以支持他们完成一次重要的职业过渡。该来访者目前在一家公司担任首席运营官（COO）的繁重职务，同时还要抚养两个年幼的孩子，并作为与他们同住的年迈父母的主要照顾者。来访者最近收到了三家不同公司的录用通知，每家公司都要求来访者及其家人搬迁。来访者来到会话时对新的工作机会感到兴奋，并希望通过会话来明确选择哪一份录用。来访者首先讨论了他们在新工作中寻找的东西，精力充沛地列出了成长机会、具有挑战性的职责、一个有才华的团队来领导，以及出差的可能性。当教练询问来访者的孩子和年迈的父母在新社区中可能需要什么时，来访者兴奋的笑容消失了，他们突然沉默了。
教练应该怎么做？
请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

options.text: 询问来访者是否愿意探索他们对无法完成这本书的恐惧。
提醒来访者，他们在过去已经实现了极具挑战性的目标，也能实现这个大目标。
询问来访者是否有过在跑马拉松时感觉跑不完的经历。邀请来访者分享他们在比赛中是如何应对这一挑战的。
支持来访者确定策略，以帮助他们推进本书剩余章节的写作。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：C(1) - A(2) - D(4/6) - B(8)

本题考察的是教练如何利用客户的语言（隐喻）来赋能客户。最佳行动（C）通过借用客户熟悉的“马拉松”隐喻（Level 1），激活了客户内在的成功经验和资源，这是最高级的唤起觉察。A选项（Level 2）处理了情绪，是合格的。D选项（Level 4）忽略了“人”而直接处理“事”。而B选项（Level 8）是最为差劲的，教练用空洞的“鸡汤”来试图掩盖客户的负面情绪，这是一种对客户当下体验的否定。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）感到绝望和“撞墙”时，如果教练（C）问我“跑步时遇到这种情况怎么办”，我会瞬间从那个无助的作者变回那个强大的跑者，我会感到力量和启发（Aha时刻）。如果教练（A）问我的恐惧，我会感到被关怀。如果教练（D）让我定策略，我会感到更累，觉得那是额外的负担。但如果教练（B）只是告诉我“你能行的”，我会觉得教练根本不懂我的痛，这种廉价的鼓励反而让我觉得孤独和被敷衍。因此C是“最佳行动”，B是“最差行动”。
title: (ICF样题7)一位教练正在与一位来访者合作，来访者是一位经验丰富的马拉松运动员，正在写一本关于耐力跑训练的书。这是来访者长久以来的梦想。教练注意到来访者在谈论他们写作中的挑战和进展时，经常使用跑步的隐喻。来访者通常都很乐观、精力充沛，但今天来到会话时显得疲惫和沮丧。他们与教练分享说，他们在写作中最近“撞墙了”，还剩下三章没写。当他们坐下来写的时候，来访者说他们几乎想不出任何东西，也没有什么值得发表的东西。来访者说他们害怕无法按时完成这本书，他们为这个目标所做的一切努力都将付诸东流。教练应该怎么做？请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务) / Level 6 (给予方向建议)。

解析：客户正处于“疲惫和沮丧”的情绪中（Level 2），而教练直接跳过了“人”，直接去处理“事”（确定策略）。这属于Level 4的范畴（聚焦未来事务）。同时，在客户能量低落时强行推进到解决问题，也带有Level 6（强行引导议题）的倾向。

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 2 (看见情绪)。这是一个很好的、支持性的行动。

解析：教练“看见”了客户当下的情绪（恐惧）并邀请探索。这符合Level 2的定义。然而，虽然它处理了情绪，但它没有利用客户独特的资源（跑步隐喻），不如C选项那样能引发深层的觉察。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 8 (直给鸡汤)。这是“最差选项”。

解析：教练试图用过去的成功来“抵消”客户当下的痛苦。这种“你以前行，现在也行”的说法，属于典型的Level 8（无效激励）。它虽然听起来是正向的，但实际上是否定了客户当下的真实感受，是一种无效的在场，教练在试图“修复”客户的情绪。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练的高级技巧。教练敏锐地捕捉到了客户的语言习惯（跑步隐喻），并将当前的困境（写作撞墙）与客户最擅长的领域（马拉松）联系起来。通过询问客户“如何应对那个挑战”，教练赋能客户从自己的内部资源中寻找答案。这完美符合Level 1的定义，即“探索客户前进的方向”并引发Aha时刻。

options.text: 承认来访者过去一年在自信心方面的成长，并邀请来访者分享他们计划如何庆祝自己入选领导力发展项目。
邀请来访者确定他们接下来想要承担的挑战。
询问来访者他们可能需要什么来维持他们新的自信。
建议来访者延长他们的教练合约，致力于一个新的目标，即晋升为领导角色。

summary:
本题教练行为从最好到最差的排名是：A(1/3) - B(4) - C(4) - D(6)

本题考察的是教练在“结束会话”中如何恰当地处理客户的成功和庆祝。最佳行动（A）通过“承认”和“庆祝”来锚定客户的成长，这是赋能的高潮。B和C选项都犯了“过早关注未来事务”（Level 4）的错误，没有给客户留出足够的空间来享受和整合成功。而D选项（Level 6）是最为差劲的，教练在客户庆祝胜利时推销续约，这是严重的主导议程和自我服务，破坏了以客户为中心的原则。

基于“客户心态”来感受：当我（客户）兴奋地分享我的提名和自信时，我最希望的是有人能和我一起庆祝这个时刻。如果教练（A）让我谈谈如何庆祝，我会感到我的努力被深深地看见了，这种成就感会倍增。如果教练（B）马上问我“下一个挑战”，我会觉得有点累，好像我永远不能停下来喘口气。如果教练（C）问我“怎么维持”，我会突然担心我会失去它。但最糟糕的是（D），如果教练在这个时候劝我“续约”，我会感觉我想“毕业”的喜悦被泼了冷水，甚至怀疑教练是不是只是想赚我的钱，而不是真的为我的独立感到高兴。因此A是“最佳行动”，D是“最差行动”。
title:
(ICF官方样题8) 一位教练已经与一位来访者合作了一年。该来访者因高质量的工作、良好的同事关系以及对未来项目的创新想法，被其主管认定为组织内的潜在领导者。然而，来访者在与高层领导的会议上很少发言，而且当他们发言时，往往会淡化或贬低自己的想法。来访者的主管建议进行教练辅导，以提高来访者的高管风范（Executive Presence），最终目标是在组织中发展成为一名领导者。在教练开始时，来访者经常自我批评。然而，来访者在最近几个月取得了巨大的进步。在他们的结束会话（Closing Session）中，教练注意到来访者带着自信、轻松的微笑。当教练与来访者分享他们的观察时，来访者回应说：“我感觉不同了，充满力量，准备好接受新的挑战。”来访者补充道：“而且我刚刚被CEO提名参加我们公司为新兴领导者举办的领导力发展项目！”
教练应该怎么做？
请判断：最佳行动（BEST）是什么？最差行动（WORST）是什么？

d.text:
9级框架评级：Level 6 (给予方向建议)。这是“最差选项”。

解析：在客户庆祝成功并即将结束教练关系的时刻，教练主动提出“延长合约”的建议，这是“以教练为中心”的表现。这属于Level 6的范畴，因为教练在强行引导议题（从“庆祝结束”引导到“续约”），并提出了一个符合教练利益（续约）而非客户当下需求（庆祝和毕业）的建议。

a.text:
9级框架评级：Level 1 (赋能探索) / Level 3 (看见处境)。这是“最佳行动”。

解析：这是PCC教练在结束会话中的典范行动。教练首先“承认...成长”，这是Level 3的“看见”。然后，教练通过“邀请...分享如何庆祝”来深度赋能客户。庆祝不仅仅是开心，它是一种“锚定”成功经验、确认客户自我价值的高级探索（Level 1）。这完全符合ICF核心能力中关于“承认客户的进步和成功”的要求。

b.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务)。

解析：客户刚刚分享了一个巨大的胜利（被提名）和一种充满力量的状态（Level 2/3），而教练直接跳过了这个庆祝时刻，立即将议程引向了下一个“任务”（挑战）。这属于Level 4的范畴，因为它忽略了当下的“人”和“成就”，过早地进入了未来的“做事”模式。

c.text:
9级框架评级：Level 4 (聚焦未来事务)。

解析：这个提问虽然看似在关心客户，但它在庆祝时刻引入了一个“维护”的任务。它隐含了一种“这种自信可能无法维持”的假设，可能会让客户从“庆祝当下”的高能量中抽离出来，去思考未来的“维护工作”。这同样属于Level 4的范畴，因为它聚焦于未来的任务，而非当下的赋能。

a.text: This is the worst action because it ignores the potential conflict of interest, violating ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standards 3.1 and 3.2 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 2, Standard 18), which require awareness and proactive management of multiple relationships. Coaching both clients without disclosure or discussion risks compromising integrity and eroding trust.

b.text: While acknowledging the conflict, this option does not go far enough to engage the client in addressing the potential impact. Simply reassuring confidentiality without inviting the client into the decision-making process can leave ethical risks unresolved. Maintaining trust requires both disclosure and collaboration when conflicts of interest arise.

c.text: This option reflects ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.2 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 6 and Section 2, Standard 18), which emphasizes managing potential conflicts of interest through ongoing dialogue. This approach promotes transparency and partnership, allowing the client to participate in determining the best course of action.

d.text: Although less ideal than full transparency, this option reflects a cautious approach to uphold ethical practice. It allows time to reflect and consult before taking further action. This pause shows an effort to manage the conflict, unlike Option A which assumes no problem exists.

options.text: Keep the information confidential and continue to coach both clients, ensuring that none of the disclosed information influences your approach with either client.
Acknowledge the potential conflict of interest to the executive client but reassure them that the information will remain confidential as per your coaching agreement.
Inform the executive client that, due to your work with a competitor, there could be a potential conflict, and suggest discussing possible next steps together.
Pause the coaching relationship with the executive client while you assess the ethical implications of the conflict of interest, then decide on a course of action.

title: As a professional coach, you are working with a client who has been struggling with work-related stress and its impact on their personal life. In a recent session, the client, an executive at a rapidly growing startup, reveals confidential strategic information about their company that could be valuable to one of your other clients in the same industry.

d.text: 虽然不如完全透明（选项C）理想，但该选项反映了维护伦理实践的谨慎态度。它留出了反思和咨询的时间，然后再采取进一步行动。这种暂停表明了管理冲突的努力，这与选项A假设不存在问题的做法不同。

a.text: 这是最差的行动，因为它忽视了潜在的利益冲突，违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.1和3.2（也体现在2020版准则：第2章第18条），这些标准要求教练对多重关系保持觉察并进行主动管理。在不进行披露或讨论的情况下同时辅导两位客户，会面临损害正直性和侵蚀信任的风险。

b.text: 虽然承认了冲突，但该选项在让客户参与解决潜在影响方面做得不够。仅仅保证保密性而不邀请客户参与决策过程，可能会遗留未解决的伦理风险。当出现利益冲突时，维持信任既需要披露，也需要协作。

c.text: 该选项反映了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.2（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第6条和第2章第18条），该标准强调通过持续的对话来管理潜在的利益冲突。这种方法促进了透明度和伙伴关系，允许客户参与确定最佳行动方案。

options.text: 对该信息保密并继续辅导这两位客户，确保所披露的信息不会影响你对任何一方的辅导方式。
向该高管客户承认存在潜在的利益冲突，但向其保证，根据你们的教练协议，该信息将严格保密。
告知该高管客户，由于你正在与其竞争对手合作，可能存在潜在的冲突，并建议共同探讨接下来的步骤。
暂停与该高管客户的教练关系，同时评估该利益冲突在伦理层面的影响，然后再决定行动方案。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你正在辅导一位深受工作压力及其对个人生活影响困扰的客户。在最近的一次会谈中，该客户（一家快速成长的初创企业的高管）透露了其公司的机密战略信息，而这些信息可能对你同一行业中的另一位客户具有价值。

options.text: Keep the information confidential, respecting the executive's trust, and continue coaching without revealing their plans to the company.
Advise the executive to discuss their plans with the company leadership directly, emphasizing the importance of transparency in their role.
Inform the company's HR department about the executive's intentions to ensure the company can prepare for the transition.
Suggest the executive reconsider their decision, citing potential negative consequences for their career if they leave the company now.

title: As a professional coach, you are engaged by a company to coach several of their executives. One of the executives confides in you about their intention to leave the company soon due to dissatisfaction with the management. This information is sensitive and could affect the company's future plans if known but has not yet been disclosed to any other party.

a.text: This option aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 2.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 3), which requires coaches to maintain the strictest level of confidentiality with all parties involved. Upholding confidentiality supports trust in the coaching relationship and ensures the client feels safe to share openly. This is foundational to ethical coaching and long-term client engagement.

b.text: This option is not the best because, although it encourages transparency, it risks pressuring the client before they are ready to act.

c.text: This choice would be a violation of the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 2.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 3), which mandates maintaining the strictest level of confidentiality with all parties involved. It breaches the trust placed in you by the client and discloses sensitive information without the client's consent, potentially causing harm to the client and damaging your professional reputation. Such an action undermines the integrity of the coaching relationship.

d.text: This option is not the worst because it maintains confidentiality, though it still fails to respect the client's autonomy and could be seen as overstepping the coach's role by advising on a personal career decision.

options.text: 对该信息保密，尊重高管的信任，并继续辅导而不向公司透露他们的计划。
建议该高管直接与公司领导层讨论他们的计划，强调在其职位上保持透明度的重要性。
告知公司的人力资源部门关于该高管的意图，以确保公司能为过渡做好准备。
建议该高管重新考虑他们的决定，并列举如果他们现在离开公司可能对其职业生涯造成的潜在负面后果。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你受雇于一家公司辅导其几位高管。其中一位高管向你透露了他们因对管理层不满而打算近期离开公司的意图。这一信息是敏感的，如果被知晓可能会影响公司的未来计划，但尚未向任何其他方披露。

a.text: 该选项符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准2.1（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第3条），该标准要求教练对所有相关方保持最严格的保密性。坚持保密性支持了教练关系中的信任，并确保客户感到安全从而可以公开分享。这是合乎伦理的教练行为和长期客户参与的基础。

b.text: 该选项并非最佳，因为尽管它鼓励透明度，但在客户准备好行动之前，它有给客户施加压力的风险。

c.text: 该选择将违反《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准2.1（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第3条），该标准强制要求对所有相关方保持最严格的保密性。它破坏了客户对你的信任，并在未经客户同意的情况下披露敏感信息，可能会对客户造成伤害并损害你的职业声誉。这样的行为破坏了教练关系的正直性。

d.text: 该选项不是最差的，因为它保持了保密性，尽管它仍然未能尊重客户的自主权，并且可能被视为因就个人职业决定提供建议而越过了教练的角色。
该选项不是最差的，因为它鼓励对文化规范的反思，但它存在在未充分理解这些规范对客户重要性的情况下，引导客户去挑战这些规范的风险。

a.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力中的“培养信任与安全”和“唤起觉察”。通过承认客户的文化背景并提出开放式问题，你允许客户在不强加你自己观点的情况下，探索这些因素如何影响他们的目标。这种方法为客户创造了反思文化压力的空间，从而培养了自我觉察、自主性以及对其决策过程的更深层洞察。

b.text: 该选项不是最佳的，因为虽然鼓励在文化期望和个人抱负之间进行调和是有价值的，但它假设了客户必须找到一种平衡，而不是允许他们探索并定义什么对他们来说是最好的。

c.text: 只关注客户的目标而不直接处理文化因素是最差的行动，因为它忽视了客户背景中的一个重要方面，而该方面深刻影响着他们的决策和压力水平。这种方法不符合“积极聆听”的ICF能力，因为它未能充分考虑客户独特的经验，并可能限制探索的深度。

options.text: 承认客户的文化背景，并提出开放式问题，邀请客户探索这些因素如何影响其个人和职业目标。
鼓励客户反思其文化背景，并探索如何将这些期望与其个人抱负相调和。
专注于客户的目标，而不直接处理文化因素，但保持对这些因素可能如何以微妙方式影响其决策的觉察。
探索客户的文化规范，将其作为当前挑战的一部分，同时建议他们反思希望挑战这些规范的哪些方面。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你正在与一位年轻的企业家客户合作，其文化背景与你截然不同。在辅导过程中，客户经常提到来自家庭的关于商业成功的文化期望和压力，这似乎与其个人抱负相冲突。你注意到这些文化因素极大地影响了他们的压力水平和决策过程。

a.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Cultivates Trust and Safety' and 'Evokes Awareness.' By acknowledging the client’s cultural background and asking open-ended questions, you allow the client to explore how these factors influence their goals without imposing your own perspective. This method creates space for the client to reflect on the cultural pressures in a way that fosters self-awareness, autonomy, and deeper insight into their decision-making process.

b.text: This option is not the best because, while encouraging reconciliation between cultural expectations and personal aspirations is valuable, it assumes the client must find a balance rather than allowing them to explore and define what’s best for them.

c.text: Focusing on the client’s goals without directly addressing the cultural factors is the worst action because it ignores a significant aspect of the client’s context that deeply influences their decision-making and stress levels. This approach does not align with the ICF competency of 'Listens Actively,' as it fails to fully consider the client's unique experience and may limit the depth of exploration.

d.text: This option is not the worst because it encourages reflection on cultural norms, but it risks steering the client toward challenging those norms without first fully understanding their importance to the client.

options.text: Acknowledge the client’s cultural background and ask open-ended questions to invite the client to explore how these factors influence their personal and professional goals.
Encourage the client to reflect on their cultural background and explore how they can reconcile these expectations with their personal aspirations.
Focus on the client’s goals without directly addressing the cultural factors, but remain aware of how these might be influencing their decisions in subtle ways.
Explore the client's cultural norms as part of their current challenges, while suggesting that they reflect on what aspects of these norms they might wish to challenge.

title: As a professional coach, you are working with a client who is a young entrepreneur from a cultural background very different from your own. During coaching sessions, the client frequently mentions cultural expectations and pressures from their family regarding business success, which seem to conflict with their personal aspirations. You notice these cultural factors greatly influence their stress levels and decision-making processes.W

a.text: 该选项虽然有帮助，但可能过于指令性，因为过早地提供了语言替代方案，可能会破坏客户自我引导的洞察力。

b.text: 该选项最符合ICF核心能力“积极聆听”和“唤起觉察”，通过反映客户的语言并促进自我反思。这种非指令性的方法邀请客户思考他们的言语如何影响其身份和视角。它支持客户的自主权，并允许在不建议替代语言的情况下进行更深层的觉察。

c.text: 这是最差的行动，因为它回避了客户体验的一个关键部分——消极自我对话——并忽视了“唤起觉察”和“积极聆听”的ICF能力。忽视语言模式可能会加强内化的消极信念，并阻碍更深层的转变。仅仅关注目标假设觉察和成长会被动发生，这在这种情况下可能并非如此。它错失了帮助客户识别和转变自我限制视角的机会。

d.text: 该选项是第二好的选择，它展示了同理心并开始探索限制性信念，但缺乏针对客户自我概念核心的语言模式的直接参与。

options.text: 温和地挑战客户的消极自我对话，鼓励他们探索这种语言如何影响他们的自我认知，同时提供更中立或积极的替代说法。
向客户回馈他们的语言，询问这些词语如何产生共鸣，并探索转变语言可能如何转变他们的视角。
主要关注他们作为单亲父母的目标，而不处理消极的自我对话，相信随着他们在生活中采取积极步骤，他们的语言会改善。
对客户的失败感表示同理心，并询问他们是否愿意审视这些信念如何影响他们当前的行动和情绪。

title: 你正在辅导一位最近经历了艰难离婚并在单亲生活中面临挑战的客户。客户在会谈中经常使用消极的自我对话，称自己在关系和育儿方面是一个“失败者”。

options.text: Gently challenge the client’s negative self-talk by encouraging them to explore how such language may be impacting their view of themselves, while offering more neutral or positive alternatives.
Reflect the client’s language back to them, asking how those words resonate and exploring how shifting their language might shift their perspective.
Focus primarily on their goals as a single parent without addressing the negative self-talk, trusting that their language will improve as they take positive steps in their life.
Empathize with the client’s feelings of failure and ask whether they’d like to examine how these beliefs are influencing their current actions and emotions.

title: You are working with a client who has recently been through a difficult divorce and is now facing challenges in managing life as a single parent. The client often uses negative self-talk during sessions, referring to themselves as a 'failure' in relationships and parenting.

a.text: This option, although helpful, may be too directive by offering language alternatives prematurely, potentially disrupting the client's self-led insight.

b.text: This option best aligns with the ICF Core Competencies 'Listens Actively' and 'Evokes Awareness' by mirroring the client's language and prompting self-reflection. This non-directive method invites the client to consider how their words affect their identity and perspective. It supports client autonomy and allows for deeper awareness without suggesting replacement language.

c.text: This is the worst action because it avoids a key part of the client's experience—negative self-talk—and neglects the ICF competencies of 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Listens Actively.' Ignoring the language patterns risks reinforcing internalized negative beliefs and hinders deeper transformation. Focusing only on goals assumes that awareness and growth will occur passively, which may not be true in this context. It bypasses an opportunity to help the client recognize and shift self-limiting perspectives.

d.text: This option is the second-best choice, which demonstrates empathy and begins to explore limiting beliefs, though it lacks the direct engagement with language patterns central to the client's self-concept.

a.text: 该选项不是最差的，因为虽然它暗示了担忧，但没有明确违反保密性；然而，它仍然游走在边缘，可能会损害客户的信任。

b.text: 这种方法符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准2.1（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第3条），该标准要求对所有相关方保持最严格的保密性。通过对客户的意图保持完全保密并告知领导层你不能披露个人细节，你维护了教练关系的正直性并确保了客户的信任。此行动尊重了客户的保密性，这在教练中至关重要。

c.text: 该选项不是最佳的，因为虽然鼓励公开沟通是有价值的，但这可能会被视为转移问题，而不是直接解决保密性的重要性。

d.text: 这种做法违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准2.1（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第3条），该标准要求教练对所有相关方保持最严格的保密性。与领导层分享客户的辞职计划是对信任和道德标准的重大违背。它无视了客户在职业决定中的隐私权和自主权。

options.text: 简要提及客户有一些可能影响其绩效的担忧，但不透露具体的意图或机密细节。
对客户的意图保持完全保密，并告知领导层你不能讨论在辅导会谈中分享的个人细节。
鼓励领导层直接与客户讨论绩效和工作满意度，以获得更清晰的见解。
与领导层分享客户的辞职计划，以帮助他们为即将到来的变化做好准备，并可能解决管理冲突。

title: 作为一名商业教练，你正在辅导一位客户，该客户私下透露因与管理层未解决的冲突而计划辞职。随后，在与赞助此次辅导的公司领导层进行的例行会议中，你被问及关于可能影响该客户绩效和工作满意度的任何因素的见解。

options.text: Briefly mention that the client has some concerns that may be affecting their performance, without disclosing specific intentions or confidential details.
Maintain complete confidentiality about the client's intentions and inform the leadership that you cannot discuss personal details shared in coaching sessions.
Encourage the leadership to directly discuss performance and job satisfaction with the client to gain clearer insights.
Share the client's plans to resign with the leadership to help them prepare for the upcoming changes and potentially address management conflicts.

title: As a business coach, you are engaged with a client who confidentially reveals plans to resign due to unresolved conflicts with management. Later, during a routine meeting with the company's leadership, who sponsored the coaching sessions, you are asked about your insights into any factors that might be influencing the client's performance and job satisfaction.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 2.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 3), which requires maintaining the strictest level of confidentiality with all parties involved. By maintaining complete confidentiality about the client's intentions and informing leadership that you cannot disclose personal details, you uphold the integrity of the coaching relationship and ensure the client's trust. This action respects the client's confidentiality, which is paramount in coaching.

c.text: This option is not the best because, while encouraging open communication is valuable, it may come across as deflecting the question rather than directly addressing the importance of confidentiality.

d.text: This approach violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 2.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 3), which requires coaches to maintain the strictest level of confidentiality with all parties involved. Sharing the client's confidential plans to resign with the leadership is a significant breach of trust and ethical standards. It disregards the client's right to privacy and autonomy in their career decisions.

a.text: This option is not the worst because while it hints at concerns, it doesn't explicitly breach confidentiality; however, it still walks a fine line and could potentially compromise the client's trust.
选项A不是最佳选择，因为虽然它试图重新聚焦于职业目标，但可能无法充分解决客户当前的迫切情感需求或对专业支持的潜在需求。

b.text: 这种方法不符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准4.3（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第8条），该标准指出教练应保持警惕，关注从教练关系中获得的价值是否发生变化，并探索客户是否会从其他专业人员或资源中受益。鼓励客户继续分享创伤经历超出了教练的范围，进入了治疗领域，而大多数教练并不具备相关资格。这种方法可能会加深客户的情感痛苦，却无法提供适当的支持或干预。它模糊了教练和治疗之间的界限，可能导致道德并发症，并可能对客户造成伤害。

c.text: 这种方法符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准4.3（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第8条），该标准指出教练应保持警惕，关注从教练关系中获得的价值是否发生变化，并在适当时候探索是否需要其他专业人员或资源。通过建议客户考虑与治疗师合作处理创伤，同时保证教练辅导可以继续专注于职业目标，你保持了教练和治疗之间的清晰界限。这种方法既承认了客户的情感需求，又保持在教练实践的范围内。

d.text: 选项D不是最差的，因为它表现出了同理心并尊重客户的自主权，但它仍然存在让会谈在没有适当资格的情况下过度偏向治疗领域的风险。

options.text: 带着同理心倾听并承认客户的经历，但温柔地将对话引导回他们的职业目标，同时保持对他们情绪状态的支持。
鼓励客户继续分享他们的创伤经历，同时微妙地提供反馈，重点关注这些经历如何与他们的职业挑战联系起来。
建议客户考虑与治疗师合作来处理创伤，同时向他们保证教练辅导可以继续专注于他们与职业相关的目标。
对客户的情绪表示同理心，询问他们希望如何继续会谈，并跟随他们的引导，同时避免提供治疗性建议。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你正在与一位处于职业生涯中层但难以晋升的客户合作。在一次会谈中，客户开始深入探讨一系列个人创伤，包括过去的虐待经历，他们认为这些阻碍了他们的职业发展。

a.text: Option A is not the best because, while it attempts to refocus on career goals, it may not adequately address the client's immediate emotional needs or the potential requirement for specialized support.

b.text: This approach does not align with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 4.3 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 8), which states that coaches should remain alert to shifts in the value received from the coaching relationship and explore whether the client would benefit from a different professional or resource. Encouraging the client to continue sharing traumatic experiences goes beyond the scope of coaching and enters the realm of therapy, for which most coaches are not qualified. This method risks deepening the client's emotional distress without providing appropriate support or intervention. It blurs the boundaries between coaching and therapy, potentially leading to ethical complications and possibly causing harm to the client.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 4.3 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 8), which states that coaches should remain alert to shifts in the value received from the coaching relationship and explore the need for a different professional or resource when appropriate. By suggesting that the client consider working with a therapist to address their trauma while reassuring them that coaching can continue to focus on career-related goals, you're maintaining clear boundaries between coaching and therapy. This method acknowledges the client's emotional needs while staying within the scope of coaching practice.

d.text: Option D is not the worst because it shows empathy and respects the client's autonomy, but it still risks allowing the session to veer too far into therapeutic territory without proper qualifications.

options.text: Listen with empathy and acknowledge the client’s experiences, but gently steer the conversation back to their career goals, while remaining supportive of their emotional state.
Encourage the client to continue sharing their traumatic experiences, while subtly offering reflections that focus on how these experiences might connect to their professional challenges.
Suggest that the client consider working with a therapist to address the trauma, while reassuring them that the coaching can continue to focus on their career-related goals.
Empathize with the client’s emotions, ask how they’d prefer to proceed with the session, and follow their lead while refraining from offering therapeutic advice.

title: As a professional coach, you are working with a client who is a mid-level manager struggling to advance in their career. During a session, the client begins to delve deeply into a series of personal traumas, including past abuse, which they believe are hindering their professional progress.

a.text: 这个选项在解决客户的职业目标和识别客户个人问题可能需要治疗支持之间取得了正确的平衡。它符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准4.3（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第8条），该标准要求教练对从教练中获得的价值的变化保持警惕，并探索其他专业人员或资源是否更合适。通过建议咨询，你既尊重了客户解决自尊问题的需求，又在教练会谈中保持专注于领导力发展。

b.text: 虽然选项B表现出了同理心，但它有模糊教练和治疗之间界限的风险。教练可能不具备解决深层心理问题的资格。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为尽管它过于僵化，但它保持了更清晰的专业界限。

d.text: 这种做法违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准4.3（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第8条），该标准要求教练对教练价值的变化保持警惕，并在适当时候探索转介给其他专业人员的需求。通过巧妙地将自尊讨论与领导力教练结合起来，模糊了教练和治疗之间的界限。这有在教练专长之外操作的风险，可能会伤害客户并损害教练关系的正直性。它未能解决客户对专业心理支持的需求。

options.text: 专注于领导力发展并承认客户的感受，同时建议他们也考虑进行专业咨询以解决更深层次的心理问题。
探索客户的不足感并提供教练工具以建立自信，同时建议如果他们觉得有需要可以寻求外部支持。
保持会谈严格专注于领导策略，虽然简要承认自尊问题，但避免深入探索。
对客户的挣扎表示同理心，巧妙地将领导力教练与关于自尊的讨论结合起来。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你正在与一位寻求提高组织内领导技能的客户合作。该客户经常讨论对其领导团队能力的不足感和焦虑，将其追溯到自尊问题。在几次会谈中，客户变得明显情绪化，并表达了不知所措的感觉，提到焦虑和低自我价值的挣扎正在影响他们专注于职业目标的能力。客户表示他们希望专注于领导力发展，但你感觉到客户需要帮助解决个人的心理挣扎。

As a professional coach, you are working with a client who is seeking to improve their leadership skills within their organization. The client frequently discusses feelings of inadequacy and anxiety about leading teams, which they trace back to issues with self-esteem. During several sessions, the client has become visibly emotional and has expressed a sense of being overwhelmed, mentioning struggles with anxiety and low self-worth that are affecting their ability to focus on their professional goals. The client says they want to focus on leadership development, but you sense the client needs help with their personal psychological struggles.

a.text: This option strikes the right balance between addressing the client's professional goals and recognizing when the client's personal issues might require therapeutic support. It aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 4.3 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 8), which calls for coaches to remain alert to shifts in the value received from coaching and to explore whether another professional or resource is more appropriate. By recommending counseling, you respect the client's need to work on self-esteem while staying focused on leadership development in coaching sessions.

b.text: While Option B shows empathy, it risks blurring the lines between coaching and therapy. The coach may not be qualified to address deep-seated psychological issues.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because, although too rigid, it maintains clearer professional boundaries.

d.text: This approach violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 4.3 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 8), which requires coaches to remain alert to changes in the value of coaching and to explore the need for referral to another professional when appropriate. By subtly integrating discussions of self-esteem with leadership coaching, it blurs the line between coaching and therapy. This risks operating outside the coach's expertise, potentially harming the client and compromising the coaching relationship's integrity. It fails to address the client's need for specialized psychological support.

options.text: Focus on leadership development and acknowledge the client’s feelings, while suggesting they also consider professional counseling for deeper psychological concerns.
Explore the client’s feelings of inadequacy and offer coaching tools to build self-confidence, while recommending that they seek outside support if they feel it’s needed.
Keep the sessions strictly focused on leadership strategies, while briefly acknowledging the self-esteem issues but avoiding deep exploration.
Empathize with the client’s struggles, subtly integrating leadership coaching with discussions of self-esteem.

d.text: Option D is not the worst because reflecting on past discussions helps the client review their thoughts, but it risks subtly influencing the client by focusing on your interpretation rather than their self-discovery.

a.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Facilitates Client Growth.' By guiding the client to explore their values and priorities, you empower them to reflect on what matters most to them, enabling them to make a decision aligned with their personal and professional goals. This method respects the client’s autonomy without inserting your own opinion into the process.

b.text: Option B is not the best because, while facilitating a pros-and-cons discussion is useful, it may not encourage the deeper reflection on values and priorities that could lead to a more meaningful decision.

c.text: Suggesting the client seek advice from additional professionals is the worst action because it shifts the responsibility for decision-making away from the client, which undermines the coaching process. This approach does not align with the ICF competency of 'Facilitates Client Growth' as it may encourage reliance on external opinions rather than fostering the client’s own decision-making ability.

options.text: Explore the client’s underlying values and priorities, guiding them to reflect on what matters most to them, without offering your personal opinion.
Facilitate a pros-and-cons discussion, encouraging the client to consider both financial and personal aspects while steering clear of providing your own opinion.
Suggest they seek advice from additional professionals, such as a career counselor or financial advisor, to get more perspectives before making a decision.
Reflect on the client’s previous discussions, offering insights into how each option aligns with what they’ve previously expressed, but without explicitly advising them on a choice.

title: You are working with a client who is trying to decide between a high-pressure, high-paying job and a less stressful position with lower pay. The client feels conflicted about balancing financial security and personal well-being. In your next session, the client directly asks for your opinion on which job offer they should accept.

options.text: 探索客户潜在的价值观和优先事项，引导他们反思对他们来说最重要的事情，而不提供你的个人意见。
促进一场利弊讨论，鼓励客户考虑财务和个人方面的因素，同时避免提供你自己的意见。
建议他们向其他专业人士（如职业顾问或财务顾问）寻求建议，以便在做决定前获得更多视角。
回顾客户之前的讨论，提供关于每个选项如何与他们之前表达的内容相一致的见解，但不明确建议他们做出选择。

title: 你正在与一位客户合作，他正试图在高压高薪的工作和压力较小但薪水较低的职位之间做出决定。客户在平衡经济保障和个人幸福感方面感到矛盾。在下一次会谈中，客户直接询问你关于他们应该接受哪份工作的意见。

c.text: 建议客户向其他专业人士寻求建议是最糟糕的行动，因为它将决策责任从客户身上转移开，这破坏了教练过程。这种方法不符合ICF“促进客户成长”的能力，因为它可能会鼓励依赖外部意见，而不是培养客户自己的决策能力。

d.text: 选项D不是最差的，因为回顾过去的讨论有助于客户审视他们的想法，但它存在通过关注你的解释而不是他们的自我发现来微妙地影响客户的风险。

a.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“引起觉察”和“促进客户成长”。通过引导客户探索他们的价值观和优先事项，你赋予了他们反思对自己最重要事物的能力，使他们能够做出符合其个人和职业目标的决定。这种方法尊重客户的自主权，且没有在过程中加入你自己的意见。

b.text: 选项B不是最好的，因为虽然促进利弊讨论是有用的，但它可能无法鼓励对价值观和优先事项进行更深层次的反思，从而导致更有意义的决定。

a.text: Option A is not the worst because it maintains the current approach that has been effective, though it misses the opportunity for growth and potential enhancement of your practice.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Embodies a Coaching Mindset', specifically 'Engages in ongoing learning and development as a coach.' By enrolling in a certified course, you're actively pursuing professional growth and expanding your coaching toolkit. This method ensures you gain a thorough understanding of cognitive-behavioral techniques before implementation, maintaining the integrity of your practice. It demonstrates a commitment to staying current with evolving coaching methodologies.

c.text: Trying out cognitive-behavioral techniques without formal training is the worst action because it risks applying an unfamiliar approach without a solid understanding, which could lead to ineffective or inappropriate coaching interventions. This violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025), specifically Standard 5.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 3, Standard 20), which requires coaches to work within the boundaries of their level of competency, expertise, and training. Experimenting with clients without proper training can compromise the coaching relationship.

d.text: Option D is not the best because it prematurely introduces an approach you're not yet fully trained in, potentially compromising coaching quality.

options.text: Continue using your current coaching strategies, as they have consistently worked well, and you don’t feel an urgent need to shift approaches just yet.
Enroll in a certified course on cognitive-behavioral coaching techniques to understand its principles before carefully integrating it into your practice.
Try out cognitive-behavioral techniques in your next coaching session, relying on your general understanding to gauge how well they work with your client.
Organize an exploratory workshop for clients to introduce the principles of cognitive-behavioral coaching and assess their interest before incorporating it formally.

title: You have been a successful executive coach for several years, primarily using a set of strategies that have proven effective for most of your clients. Recently, you've read about a cognitive-behavioral coaching approach that has shown promising results in academic studies.

options.text: 继续使用你目前的教练策略，因为它们一直行之有效，且你觉得目前没有改变方法的迫切需求。
报名参加认知行为教练技术的认证课程，以在将其谨慎融入你的实践之前理解其原则。
在下一次教练会谈中尝试认知行为技术，依靠你的大致理解来衡量其对客户的效果。
为客户组织一次探索性研讨会，介绍认知行为教练的原则，并在正式引入前评估他们的兴趣。

title: 你作为一名成功的企业教练已从业多年，主要使用一套对大多数客户都行之有效的策略。最近，你读到了一种认知行为教练法，该方法在学术研究中显示出可喜的成果。

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为它保持了当前行之有效的方法，尽管它错失了成长和潜在提升你实践的机会。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“体现教练思维”，特别是“作为教练进行持续的学习和发展”。通过报名参加认证课程，你正在积极追求职业成长并扩展你的教练工具箱。这种方法确保你在实施之前对认知行为技术有透彻的理解，从而维护你实践的正直性。它表明了紧跟不断发展的教练方法的承诺。

c.text: 在没有受过正规培训的情况下尝试认知行为技术是最糟糕的行为，因为它冒着在没有扎实理解的情况下应用不熟悉方法的风险，这可能导致无效或不恰当的教练干预。这违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》，特别是标准5.1（也体现在2020版准则：第3章第20条），该标准要求教练在其能力、专长和培训范围内工作。在没有适当培训的情况下在客户身上做实验可能会损害教练关系。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为它过早地引入了一种你尚未完全受训的方法，可能会损害教练质量。

options.text: Continue using the same techniques, encouraging the client to stay consistent in applying them, as progress may take more time.
Explore with the client what aspects of the current techniques have been helpful or not, and reflect on your coaching to identify potential adjustments that better fit their needs.
Consider whether the client’s lack of progress may be due to their apparent reluctance to change.
Enroll in a short course on advanced communication coaching techniques.

title: As a professional coach, you have been working with a client on improving their communication skills in the workplace. After several sessions, the client has made some progress but feels that the techniques discussed are not significantly impacting their ability to communicate effectively with their team. You are considering how to adjust your coaching approach to better support the client’s goals.

a.text: Option A is not the worst because consistency is valuable, but it may lead to frustration if the techniques are not being adapted to better meet the client’s needs.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Listens Actively' and 'Facilitates Client Growth.' By exploring with the client which aspects of the techniques have been helpful or not, you involve them in the process of reflection and adjustment. This collaborative approach ensures that the coaching aligns more closely with the client's specific needs and preferences, empowering them to take ownership of their progress.

c.text: Assuming the client’s lack of progress is due to their reluctance to change is the worst action because it shifts the focus away from the coaching process and places blame on the client. This does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Maintains Presence' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety,' as it fails to explore potential adjustments to your coaching methods or support the client in understanding any barriers to progress.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while additional training may help in the long term, it doesn't immediately address the client's current challenge or involve them in the solution.

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为坚持是有价值的，但如果技巧没有被调整以更好地满足客户的需求，它可能会导致挫败感。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“积极倾听”和“促进客户成长”。通过与客户探讨技巧的哪些方面有帮助或没帮助，你让他们参与到反思和调整的过程中。这种合作方式确保教练辅导更紧密地符合客户的具体需求和偏好，赋予他们掌控自己进步的权力。

c.text: 假设客户缺乏进步是由于他们不愿改变是最糟糕的行为，因为它将焦点从教练过程转移开，并将责任归咎于客户。这不符合ICF能力“保持在场”和“培养信任与安全”，因为它未能探索对教练方法的潜在调整，也未能支持客户理解任何进步障碍。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然额外的培训长期来看可能有帮助，但它不能立即解决客户当前的挑战或让他们参与到解决方案中。

options.text: 继续使用相同的技巧，鼓励客户坚持应用它们，因为进步可能需要更多时间。
与客户一起探讨当前技巧的哪些方面有帮助或没有帮助，并反思你的教练方式，以确定更适合他们需求的潜在调整。
考虑客户缺乏进步是否可能是由于他们表面上不愿改变。
报名参加关于高级沟通教练技巧的短期课程。

title: 作为一名专业教练，你一直致力于帮助一位客户提高职场沟通技巧。经过几次会谈，客户取得了一些进步，但感觉讨论的技巧并没有显著影响他们与团队有效沟通的能力。你正在考虑如何调整你的教练方法以更好地支持客户的目标。

options.text: Explore with the client how to adopt the local work habits and communication styles to fit in better with their colleagues.
Explore the client’s current cultural challenges in-depth, using the session to understand how these factors impact their work and personal life.
Encourage the client to keep their unique style despite cultural differences.
Organize a session focusing on general stress management techniques, avoiding the specific cultural context as you’re not familiar with it.

title: You are working with a client who recently moved to a new country for a high-profile job. The client is experiencing cultural challenges at work that affect their performance and sense of belonging. They feel that their communication style and work habits are often misinterpreted due to cultural differences, leading to feelings of isolation and frustration.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Listens Actively' and 'Evokes Awareness.' By exploring the client’s cultural challenges in-depth, you support them in gaining insights into how these factors impact their work and personal life. This fosters self-awareness and empowers the client to navigate their situation authentically. It also respects the client’s values and experiences, allowing for a more personalized and meaningful conversation.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because, while it may not be the most effective approach, encouraging the client to keep their unique style still acknowledges the importance of the client’s personal identity.

d.text: This approach is the worst because it avoids addressing the client's specific issue—cultural challenges—which is central to their current experience. It does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety,' as it fails to create a safe space for the client to explore a critical issue in their life. Additionally, avoiding the cultural context because of the coach’s unfamiliarity undermines the partnership and adaptability expected from the coach.

a.text: Option A is not the best because it focuses on having the client adopt local work habits and communication styles too quickly, which could feel like forcing adaptation rather than encouraging the client to explore their own identity and how they wish to approach the cultural challenges in a way that honors their individuality.

title: 你正在与一位客户合作，该客户最近因一份要职搬到了一个新的国家。客户在工作中正经历着影响其绩效和归属感的文化挑战。他们觉得自己的沟通方式和工作习惯经常因文化差异而被误解，导致了孤独和沮丧感。

a.text: 选项A不是最佳选择，因为它侧重于让客户过快地采用当地的工作习惯和沟通方式，这可能让人感觉像是在强迫适应，而不是鼓励客户探索自己的身份以及他们希望如何以尊重自己个性的方式应对文化挑战。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“积极倾听”和“引起觉察”。通过深入探讨客户的文化挑战，你支持他们获得关于这些因素如何影响其工作和个人生活的见解。这培养了自我意识，并赋予客户以真实的方式驾驭其处境的能力。这也尊重了客户的价值观和经历，允许进行更个性化和有意义的对话。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为虽然它可能不是最有效的方法，但鼓励客户保持其独特的风格仍然承认了客户个人身份的重要性。

d.text: 这种方法是最糟糕的，因为它避免解决客户的具体问题——文化挑战——这正是他们当前体验的核心。这不符合ICF能力“引起觉察”和“培养信任与安全”，因为它未能为客户创造一个安全的空间来探索其生活中的关键问题。此外，因教练的不熟悉而避免文化背景，破坏了教练应有的伙伴关系和适应性。

options.text: 与客户探讨如何采用当地的工作习惯和沟通方式，以便更好地融入同事之中。
深入探讨客户当前的文化挑战，利用会谈来理解这些因素如何影响他们的工作和个人生活。
鼓励客户尽管存在文化差异，仍保持他们独特的风格。
组织一次专注于一般压力管理技巧的会谈，因为你不熟悉具体的文化背景，所以避免触及它。
Offer immediate solutions to improve team performance and avoid similar issues in future projects.
Summarize what the client has said about the project to ensure you have correctly understood their main concerns, and ask clarifying questions about specific challenges they mentioned.
Acknowledge the client’s frustration and continue the conversation to focus on general team management strategies.
Note down key points for later discussion and continue listening without interrupting the client's flow of thoughts.

title: As a professional development coach, you are working with a client who is aiming to enhance their leadership skills within their organization. During a session, the client begins to discuss a recent project where things didn't go as planned, leading to unexpected challenges. The client speaks quickly and with some frustration, mentioning several issues but focusing on their disappointment with team performance.

a.text: This approach does not align with the ICF core competency of 'Evokes Awareness', as it shifts the focus to problem-solving before the client has fully processed or reflected on their experience. Offering immediate solutions limits the client’s opportunity to explore the situation in depth and develop their own insights. It may also reinforce a dependent dynamic, rather than fostering client autonomy.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competency of 'Listens Actively', as it demonstrates that the coach is fully present and attuned to both the content and emotional tone of the client's communication. By summarizing and asking clarifying questions, the coach helps the client feel heard while also deepening mutual understanding. This supports clearer thinking and opens the door to deeper exploration of the client's leadership challenges. It encourages thoughtful reflection rather than reactive problem-solving.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because it acknowledges the client's emotions and maintains the conversation, although it may fall short of directly addressing the specific issues raised. Effective coaching encourages reflection and inquiry over quick advice.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, although it shows patience, it misses a key moment to co-create clarity and insight with the client.

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为它承认了客户的情绪并维持了对话，尽管它可能无法直接解决提出的具体问题。有效的教练鼓励反思和探究，而不是快速提供建议。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为尽管它表现出了耐心，但它错失了与客户共同创造清晰度和洞察力的关键时刻。

a.text: 这种方法不符合ICF核心能力“引起觉察”，因为它在客户充分处理或反思其经历之前就将焦点转移到了解决问题上。提供即时解决方案限制了客户深入探索情况并发展自己见解的机会。这还可能强化依赖动态，而不是培养客户的自主性。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“积极倾听”，因为它表明教练完全在场并能适应客户沟通的内容和情感基调。通过总结和提出澄清性问题，教练帮助客户感到被倾听，同时也加深了相互理解。这支持了更清晰的思考，并开启了对客户领导力挑战更深层探索的大门。它鼓励深思熟虑的反思，而不是反应性的解决问题。

options.text: 提供立即改善团队绩效的解决方案，以避免未来项目中出现类似问题。
总结客户关于该项目所说的内容，以确保你正确理解了他们的主要关注点，并针对他们提到的具体挑战提出澄清性问题。
承认客户的挫败感，并继续对话以关注一般的团队管理策略。
记下关键点以便稍后讨论，并继续倾听而不打断客户的思路。

title: 作为一名专业发展教练，你正在与一位旨在提升其组织内领导技能的客户合作。在一次会谈中，客户开始讨论最近一个并未按计划进行的项目，该项目导致了意想不到的挑战。客户语速很快且带有一些挫败感，提到几个问题，但主要关注点是对团队绩效的失望。

options.text: Share your personal experience with divorce to show empathy and solidarity, hoping it will comfort the client.
Acknowledge the client's emotions and then refocus the discussion on strategies to manage their emotional responses at work and home.
Allow the sessions to focus mainly on the client’s emotional venting, considering it a necessary outlet for them.
Take a moment to manage your own emotional response, ensuring that you can remain composed and professional.

title: You are working with a client who is going through a contentious divorce, which is impacting their emotional well-being and productivity at work. The client often becomes visibly upset and sometimes angry during sessions, expressing frustration over their personal situation. You find yourself feeling increasingly emotionally involved and sympathetic, as you went through a similar experience recently.

a.text: This approach risks shifting the focus away from the client’s experience and can blur professional boundaries. Sharing personal experiences may lead to the client feeling that their situation is being compared or overshadowed, and it can detract from the client-centered nature of the coaching relationship. It does not align with the ICF Core Competencies, which emphasize maintaining a professional and client-focused approach.

b.text: Option B is not the best because, although it addresses the client's emotions and provides strategies, it does not consider the importance of the coach managing their own emotional state first to ensure professionalism and effectiveness.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because, while it allows the client to vent, it fails to provide the constructive support and strategies needed to manage their emotions and improve their productivity.

d.text: This option aligns with the ICF competency of 'Maintains Presence,' which emphasizes the ability of the coach to remain fully conscious, present, and emotionally balanced throughout the coaching process. By managing your own emotions first, you ensure that you are able to provide the objective, supportive guidance needed. This helps maintain professional boundaries while still supporting the client effectively, enabling a focus on constructive solutions.

options.text: 分享你个人离婚的经历以通过共情和团结来安慰客户，希望这能给客户带来慰藉。
承认客户的情绪，然后重新聚焦讨论，制定在工作和家庭中管理情绪反应的策略。
允许会谈主要集中在客户的情绪宣泄上，认为这对他们来说是一个必要的出口。
花一点时间管理你自己的情绪反应，确保你能保持镇定和专业。

title: 你正在与一位正在经历有争议离婚的客户合作，这影响了他们的情感健康和工作效率。客户在会谈中经常变得明显不安，有时甚至愤怒，表达对个人处境的挫败感。你会发现自己越来越情绪化地卷入其中并产生同情，因为你最近也有类似的经历。

b.text: 选项B不是最佳选择，因为虽然它解决了客户的情绪并提供了策略，但它没有考虑到教练首先管理好自己的情绪状态以确保专业性和有效性的重要性。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为虽然它允许客户宣泄，但它未能提供管理情绪和提高生产力所需的建设性支持和策略。

d.text: 该选项符合ICF能力“保持在场”，该能力强调教练在整个教练过程中保持完全清醒、在场和情绪平衡的能力。通过首先管理自己的情绪，你确保自己能够提供所需的客观、支持性指导。这有助于维持专业界限，同时仍能有效地支持客户，从而专注于建设性的解决方案。

a.text: 这种方法有将焦点从客户的体验上转移开的风险，并可能模糊专业界限。分享个人经历可能会导致客户感觉他们的处境被比较或被掩盖，这可能会削弱教练关系中以客户为中心的本质。这不符合ICF核心能力，后者强调保持专业和以客户为中心的方法。
Option A is not the worst because, while it attempts to focus on the client, it still risks compromising the quality of the session due to your emotional distraction.

b.text: Option B is not the best because, while it acknowledges the situation, it may still leave you distracted and unable to fully concentrate on the client’s needs.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Core Competencies by ensuring that you are fully present and able to provide the best possible support for your client. It demonstrates a commitment to maintaining professionalism and quality in your coaching practice. By postponing the session, you prioritize both your well-being and the client’s needs, ensuring that the coaching engagement is effective and focused.

d.text: This approach shifts the focus away from the client’s experience and can blur professional boundaries. Sharing your own emotional state may not be appropriate and can detract from the client-centered nature of the coaching relationship. It fails to maintain the professional distance necessary to provide objective and effective support.

options.text: Proceed with the session as planned, doing your best to manage your emotions internally while staying focused on the client’s needs.
Mention to the client that you’ve received some difficult personal news but assure them that you are ready to focus on their session and continue as planned.
Reschedule the session for a later time, explaining that you want to ensure you are fully present to support the client’s needs.
Acknowledge your emotional state with the client, sharing some personal insights and exploring how both of you might work through these emotional challenges together.

title: You are about to start a session with a new client who has been laid off unexpectedly from a high-level position. This client is notably anxious about their future and unsure about the direction they should take. Just before the session, you receive upsetting personal news that could impact your ability to remain focused.

options.text: 按计划进行会谈，尽最大努力在内部管理你的情绪，同时保持专注于客户的需求。
向客户提及你收到了一些艰难的个人消息，但向他们保证你准备好专注于他们的会谈并按计划继续。
将会谈重新安排在稍后的时间，并解释你想确保自己能完全“在场”以支持客户的需求。
与客户确认你的情绪状态，分享一些个人见解，并探索你们双方如何共同克服这些情绪挑战。

title: 你即将开始与一位新客户的会谈，该客户意外从高层职位被解雇。这位客户对未来明显感到焦虑，并且不确定应该采取的方向。就在会谈前，你收到了可能会影响你保持专注能力的令人沮丧的个人消息。

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为虽然它试图专注于客户，但由于你的情绪分心，它仍然有损害会谈质量的风险。

b.text: 选项B不是最佳选择，因为虽然它承认了情况，但它可能仍然让你分心，无法完全集中精力满足客户的需求。

c.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力，因为它确保你完全“在场”并能够为客户提供尽可能最好的支持。它表明了对在教练实践中保持专业性和质量的承诺。通过推迟会谈，你优先考虑了你的幸福感和客户的需求，确保教练契约是有效和专注的。

d.text: 这种方法将焦点从客户的体验上转移开，并可能模糊专业界限。分享你自己的情绪状态可能是不恰当的，并可能削弱教练关系中以客户为中心的本质。它未能保持提供客观和有效支持所需的专业距离。

a.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements' and 'Evokes Awareness.' Creating a detailed report of career options and paths for the client contradicts the core principles of coaching, which emphasize client empowerment and self-discovery. This method positions the coach as an expert providing solutions, rather than facilitating the client's own decision-making process. It may undermine the client's sense of ownership over their career journey and the insights they've gained.

b.text: Option B is not the worst because it involves the client in confirming and adjusting the summary, but it still places too much emphasis on the coach's perspective rather than the client's own reflections.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Core Competencies by fostering client autonomy and encouraging them to take ownership of their progress and insights. By allowing the client to lead the final session, you empower them to articulate their learning and future plans, reinforcing their confidence and self-efficacy. This method ensures that the client fully integrates and acknowledges their development, which is crucial for sustained growth and action.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while it provides valuable feedback on the coaching process, it doesn't fully engage the client in reflecting on and articulating their own progress and decisions.

options.text: Create a detailed report that outlines all the career options and paths discussed, and give it to the client at the start of the final session.
Design a session where you summarize the client’s progress and insights, then discuss these findings to the client for their confirmation and adjustment.
Encourage the client to lead the final session by sharing their reflections on their discoveries and decisions made during the coaching engagement.
Provide the client with a questionnaire to capture their feedback on the coaching process and their learnings.

title: As a career coach, you are nearing the end of a coaching engagement with a client who has been exploring new career paths after a significant industry shift. Over the course of several sessions, the client has identified their core competencies, potential career options, and personal barriers to change.

options.text: 创建一份详细的报告，概述所有讨论过的职业选择和路径，并在最后一次会谈开始时交给客户。
设计一次会谈，在会上你总结客户的进步和见解，然后与客户讨论这些发现以供其确认和调整。
鼓励客户通过分享他们对辅导契约期间的发现和决定的反思来主导最后一次会谈。
向客户提供一份问卷，以收集他们对辅导过程及其学习成果的反馈。

title: 作为一名职业教练，你与一位在经历了重大行业转变后一直在探索新职业道路的客户的辅导契约即将结束。在几次会谈过程中，客户已经确定了他们的核心竞争力、潜在的职业选择以及改变的个人障碍。

a.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力“建立和维持协议”及“引起觉察”。为客户创建一份详细的职业选择和路径报告与教练的核心原则相矛盾，后者强调客户赋能和自我发现。这种方法将教练定位为提供解决方案的专家，而不是促进客户自己的决策过程。它可能会削弱客户对其职业旅程的主人翁感以及他们所获得的见解。

b.text: 选项B不是最差的，因为它涉及客户确认和调整总结，但它仍然过分强调教练的观点，而不是客户自己的反思。

c.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力，即通过培养客户的自主权并鼓励他们对自己的进步和见解负责。通过允许客户主导最后一次会谈，你赋予了他们表达学习成果和未来计划的能力，从而增强了他们的自信和自我效能感。这种方法确保客户完全整合并认可他们的发展，这对于持续的成长和行动至关重要。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然它提供了关于教练过程的有价值反馈，但它并没有让客户充分参与反思和表达他们自己的进步和决定。

title: As a business coach, you are starting a new engagement with a client who leads a rapidly growing startup. During the initial consultation, the client expresses interest in enhancing their leadership skills and improving team collaboration. However, they also mention a desire to discuss strategic business decisions as part of your sessions.

a.text: This approach is the worst because it blurs the boundaries between coaching and consulting, which can create confusion about the nature of the engagement and the expectations of the client. It fails to uphold the ICF Core Competency 'Demonstrates Ethical Practice,' specifically sub-competency 6, which calls for coaches to maintain the distinctions between coaching, consulting, psychotherapy, and other support professions. Combining roles without clear boundaries risks diluting the coaching process.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Core Competency 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements' by ensuring clarity and mutual agreement on the scope of the coaching relationship. By clearly defining the difference between coaching and consulting, you set appropriate boundaries and manage the client's expectations effectively. This helps maintain the integrity of the coaching process while ensuring that the client understands the distinct value of each service.

c.text: Option C is not the best because, while it addresses the client's needs, it may complicate the relationship by introducing a dual role that could blur the lines between coaching and consulting.

d.text: Option D is not the worst because, while it may miss an opportunity to address broader client needs, it maintains the integrity of the coaching role.

options.text: Agree to include strategic business consulting in your sessions, balancing both coaching and consulting to address all aspects of the client’s needs.
Define the distinction between coaching and consulting, setting clear expectations and boundaries for your coaching sessions, while acknowledging the client’s broader needs.
Suggest creating a separate consulting contract to address the strategic business aspects, keeping your coaching sessions focused on leadership and team development.
Focus exclusively on the coaching aspects related to leadership and team collaboration, politely declining to incorporate strategic business consulting into the sessions.
同意在会谈中包含战略业务咨询，平衡教练和咨询以满足客户的所有需求方面。
定义教练和咨询之间的区别，为你的教练会谈设定明确的期望和界限，同时承认客户更广泛的需求。
建议制定一份单独的咨询合同来解决战略业务方面的问题，使你的教练会谈专注于领导力和团队发展。
专注于与领导力和团队协作相关的教练方面，礼貌地拒绝将战略业务咨询纳入会谈中。

title: 作为一名商业教练，你正在开始与一位领导一家快速成长初创公司的客户进行新的接触。在初步咨询中，客户表示有兴趣提高其领导技能并改善团队协作。然而，他们也提到希望在会谈中讨论战略业务决策。

a.text: 这种方法是最糟糕的，因为它模糊了教练和咨询之间的界限，这可能会对契约的性质和客户的期望造成混淆。它未能坚持ICF核心能力“展示道德实践”，特别是子能力6，该能力要求教练保持教练、咨询、心理治疗和其他支持职业之间的区别。在没有清晰界限的情况下合并角色会有稀释教练过程的风险。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“建立和维持协议”，通过确保对教练关系范围的清晰度和相互一致来实现。通过明确定义教练和咨询之间的区别，你设定了适当的界限并有效地管理了客户的期望。这有助于维护教练过程的完整性，同时确保客户理解每种服务的独特价值。

c.text: 选项C不是最佳选择，因为虽然它解决了客户的需求，但它可能会通过引入双重角色使关系复杂化，这可能会模糊教练和咨询之间的界限。

d.text: 选项D不是最差的，因为虽然它可能错失了解决客户更广泛需求的机会，但它维护了教练角色的完整性。

options.text: Conduct the evaluation to maintain consistency with your mentoring.
Decline the evaluation due to the existing mentor relationship.
Proceed only if the mentee agrees in writing to the dual role.
Inform the program director but proceed unless a conflict is formally raised.

title: You are an ICF-credentialed coach serving as both a mentor coach and a performance evaluator in a coach training program. One of the individuals you have mentored is now up for program completion, and you are assigned to evaluate their recorded coaching session.

c.text: Option C is the second best because obtaining written consent offers some transparency, but the inherent power dynamic between mentor and mentee can still compromise perceived impartiality.

d.text: Option D is the second worst because while it involves notifying the program director, it still places the burden of raising the issue on others and doesn’t proactively resolve the conflict.

a.text: Option A is the worst action because it ignores the conflict of interest between being a mentor and an evaluator, violating ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.1. This dual role risks compromising objectivity and fairness in the evaluation process. It also fails to meet Core Competency 1: Demonstrates Ethical Practice.

b.text: Option B is the best action because it aligns with ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.1 (also reflected in the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 10), which requires avoiding dual relationships that may impair objectivity or create a conflict of interest. Declining the evaluation protects both the mentee and the integrity of the assessment process.
选项B是最佳行动，因为它符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.1（也体现在2020版准则：第1章第10条），该标准要求避免可能损害客观性或造成利益冲突的双重关系。拒绝评估既保护了学员，也维护了评估过程的正直性。

c.text: 选项C是次优选，因为获得书面同意提供了一定的透明度，但导师和学员之间固有的权力动态仍可能损害人们对公正性的看法。

d.text: 选项D是倒数第二差的，因为虽然它涉及通知项目总监，但它仍然将提出问题的负担推给他人，并没有主动解决冲突。

a.text: 选项A是最差的行动，因为它忽视了作为导师和评估者之间的利益冲突，违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.1。这种双重角色可能会损害评估过程的客观性和公平性。它也未能满足核心能力1：展示道德实践。

options.text: 进行评估以保持与你指导的一致性。
由于存在的导师关系，拒绝进行评估。
只有在学员书面同意双重角色的情况下才继续进行。
通知项目总监，但除非有人正式提出冲突，否则继续进行。

title: 你是一名获得ICF认证的教练，在某教练培训项目中同时担任导师教练（Mentor Coach）和绩效评估员。你曾指导过的一名学员现在即将结业，你被指派评估他们的录音教练会谈。

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while it allows for a trial period, it may still lack the comprehensive clarity and commitment provided by a detailed written agreement.

a.text: This approach risks misunderstandings and lacks the necessary structure to ensure a successful coaching engagement. Proceeding without clearly defined expectations can lead to confusion around logistics, boundaries, and confidentiality, especially when additional individuals may be involved. This fails to uphold the ICF Core Competency 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements,' particularly sub-competency 3, which emphasizes reaching agreement about the guidelines and specific parameters of the coaching relationship.

b.text: This choice aligns with the ICF competency 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements.' It involves clearly defining the roles, responsibilities, and expectations for both the coach and the client, including the logistical aspects of the coaching process. A detailed agreement ensures that both parties are on the same page regarding how the coaching will proceed, which helps in maintaining professionalism and clarity. This approach also safeguards the confidentiality aspects, particularly when third parties (like key staff) might be involved in sessions.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because it attempts to offer a structure with flexibility, but it still lacks the comprehensive clarity needed to address the client's specific needs and uphold professional standards.

options.text: Proceed with the coaching sessions based on a general understanding of the client’s availability and enthusiasm, planning to clarify details like scheduling and confidentiality as the sessions progress.

Collaborate with the client on a comprehensive written agreement that includes logistics, fees, scheduling, confidentiality, and conditions for involving others, ensuring clarity before starting any sessions.
Propose a flexible structure, allowing the client to decide session by session when to meet and whether to include others, adjusting the arrangement as needed.
Recommend starting with a trial period, drafting a contract that outlines key terms while allowing both sides to assess how the arrangement works before finalizing it.

title: You are initiating a coaching engagement with a new client who runs a small business. During the initial meeting, the client seems enthusiastic but is vague about their availability and hesitant to commit to a regular schedule. They also mention possibly involving key staff members in some sessions.

a.text: 这种方法存在误解的风险，缺乏确保成功教练契约所需的结构。在没有明确定义期望的情况下继续进行可能会导致围绕后勤、界限和保密性的混乱，尤其是在可能涉及其他人的情况下。这未能坚持ICF核心能力“建立和维持协议”，特别是子能力3，该能力强调就教练关系的准则和具体参数达成协议。

b.text: 这一选择符合ICF能力“建立和维持协议”。它涉及明确定义教练和客户双方的角色、责任和期望，包括教练过程的后勤方面。一份详细的协议确保双方在教练如何进行方面达成共识，这有助于保持专业性和清晰度。这种方法还保障了保密性方面，特别是当第三方（如关键员工）可能参与会谈时。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为它试图提供一种灵活的结构，但它仍然缺乏解决客户特定需求和维护专业标准所需的全面清晰度。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然它允许试用期，但它可能仍然缺乏详细书面协议所提供的全面清晰度和承诺。

options.text: 基于对客户可用时间和热情的总体了解开始教练会谈，计划随着会谈的进行再澄清日程安排和保密性等细节。
与客户合作制定一份全面的书面协议，包括后勤、费用、日程安排、保密性以及涉及他人的条件，确保在开始任何会谈前清晰明确。
提议一个灵活的结构，允许客户逐次决定何时会面以及是否包括他人，并根据需要调整安排。
建议从试用期开始，起草一份概述关键条款的合同，同时允许双方在最终确定之前评估该安排的效果。

title: 你正在与一位经营小企业的新客户启动教练契约。在初次会议中，客户看起来很热情，但对他们的可用时间含糊其辞，并对承诺定期的时间表犹豫不决。他们还提到可能让关键员工参与某些会谈。

options.text: Offer strategies and steps based on your knowledge and experience in career transitions.
Validate the client’s feelings of anxiety and excitement, encourage exploration of these emotions, and how they can harness them positively in their career transition journey.
Direct your client to resources and professionals within the new industry to seek advice and mentoring.
Ask your client to reconsider the transition, highlighting the risks involved in moving to a new industry and the value of their existing expertise and network.

title: You are coaching a client who is transitioning to a new career path after many years in their current field. The client expresses excitement about the change but also significant anxiety about starting over and facing unknown challenges. They are particularly concerned about their ability to adapt to a new industry where they have less experience. In your sessions, the client often seeks reassurance and specific advice on how to succeed in this new phase of their career.

a.text: Option A is not the worst because offering strategies based on experience can be helpful, but it risks making the coach an advisor rather than a facilitator of the client's own problem-solving process.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Cultivates Trust and Safety' and 'Evokes Awareness.' By validating the client’s feelings, you acknowledge their experience and build trust. Encouraging the client to explore and understand their emotions helps them manage anxiety and harness excitement productively. This method empowers the client to develop emotional resilience and confidence in their ability to navigate the transition, supporting their long-term success.

c.text: Option C is not the best because, while it provides helpful resources, it shifts the focus away from the client’s internal process and self-discovery.

d.text: This approach does not align with the ICF Core Competencies, specifically 'Embodies a Coaching Mindset' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety'. Asking the client to reconsider their transition and highlighting the risks undermines the client's autonomy and decision-making process. It imposes the coach's fears or biases onto the client, potentially discouraging them from pursuing their chosen path. This method fails to honor the client's excitement about the change and doesn't support their growth or exploration of new possibilities. It contradicts the coaching principle of believing in the client's potential and capacity for change.

options.text: 根据你在职业转型方面的知识和经验提供策略和步骤。
认可客户的焦虑和兴奋感，鼓励探索这些情绪，以及如何在职业转型旅程中积极利用它们。
引导客户去寻找新行业内的资源和专业人士，以寻求建议和指导。
要求客户重新考虑转型，强调进入新行业涉及的风险以及他们现有专业知识和网络的价值。

title: 你正在辅导一位在当前领域工作多年后正转型到新职业道路的客户。客户对这一变化表示兴奋，但也对从头开始和面对未知的挑战感到极度焦虑。他们特别担心自己适应经验较少的新行业的能力。在会谈中，客户经常寻求安慰以及关于如何在其职业生涯这一新阶段取得成功的具体建议。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“培养信任与安全”和“引起觉察”。通过认可客户的感受，你承认了他们的体验并建立了信任。鼓励客户探索和理解他们的情绪有助于他们管理焦虑并富有成效地利用兴奋感。这种方法赋予客户发展情感韧性和自信的能力，以驾驭转型，支持他们的长期成功。

c.text: 选项C不是最佳选择，因为虽然它提供了有用的资源，但它将焦点从客户的内在过程和自我发现上转移开了。

d.text: 这种方法不符合ICF核心能力，特别是“体现教练思维”和“培养信任与安全”。要求客户重新考虑他们的转型并强调风险，破坏了客户的自主权和决策过程。它将教练的恐惧或偏见强加给客户，可能会打消他们追求所选道路的念头。这种方法未能尊重客户对改变的兴奋感，也不支持他们的成长或对新可能性的探索。它与相信客户潜力和改变能力的教练原则相矛盾。

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为根据经验提供策略可能是有帮助的，但它有使教练成为顾问而不是客户自己解决问题过程的促进者的风险。

d.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Maintains Presence' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety.' Redirecting the client's focus back to their progress and achievements ignores the significant emotional shift that has occurred. This method demonstrates a lack of sensitivity to the client's current emotional state and misses an opportunity to explore potentially important underlying issues. It may make the client feel unheard or that their complex emotions around success are invalid. This approach fails to adapt to the evolving needs of the client within the session.

a.text: Option A is not the best because, while it allows for elaboration, it doesn't directly address the observed shift in the client's demeanor, potentially missing an opportunity for deeper exploration.

b.text: Option B is not the worst because it shows concern for the client's comfort, but it may be overly cautious and doesn't actively encourage exploration of the emotional shift.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Listens Actively' and 'Evokes Awareness.' By acknowledging the noticeable shift in the client's energy and inviting them to explore what might be coming up for them, you're demonstrating keen observation and creating space for deeper self-reflection. This method shows attentiveness to the client's non-verbal cues and emotional states, allowing for a more holistic exploration of their experience. It encourages the client to examine their internal processes and potentially uncover insights about their reaction to success.

options.text: Reflect the client’s last statement, giving them an opportunity to elaborate on their thoughts and feelings.
Gently ask the client if they feel comfortable continuing the conversation, offering them a chance to pause if needed.
Acknowledge the noticeable shift in their energy and invite them to explore what might be coming up for them in this moment.
Redirect the client’s focus back to their progress and achievements, encouraging them to reflect on their successes.

title: A client is discussing their recent success in achieving a major milestone in their personal development journey. They express excitement about their progress and how they’ve been able to overcome obstacles. Suddenly, their tone suddenly shifts, and they become noticeably quieter.

d.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力“保持在场”和“培养信任与安全”。将客户的注意力重定向回他们的进步和成就，忽视了已经发生的重大情绪转变。这种方法表明对客户当前情绪状态缺乏敏感性，并错失了探索潜在重要潜在问题的机会。这可能会让客户感到没被听见，或者觉得他们围绕成功的复杂情绪是无效的。这种方法未能适应会谈中客户不断变化的需求。

a.text: 选项A不是最佳选择，因为虽然它允许详细阐述，但它没有直接解决观察到的客户举止的转变，可能会错失更深层探索的机会。

b.text: 选项B不是最差的，因为它表现出对客户舒适度的关心，但它可能过于谨慎，并没有积极鼓励探索情绪的转变。

c.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“积极倾听”和“引起觉察”。通过承认客户能量上的明显转变并邀请他们探索此刻可能涌现的内容，你展示了敏锐的观察力，并为更深层的自我反思创造了空间。这种方法显示了对客户非语言线索和情绪状态的关注，允许对其体验进行更全面的探索。它鼓励客户审视其内在过程，并可能发现关于其对成功反应的见解。

options.text: 反馈客户的最后陈述，给他们机会详细阐述他们的想法和感受。
温柔地询问客户是否觉得继续对话很舒服，如果需要的话提供暂停的机会。
承认他们能量上的明显转变，并邀请他们探索此刻内心可能涌现出了什么。
将客户的注意力重定向回他们的进步和成就，鼓励他们反思自己的成功。

title: 一位客户正在讨论他们最近在个人发展旅程中实现一个重要里程碑的成功。他们对自己的进步以及如何能够克服障碍表示兴奋。突然，他们的语调变了，变得明显安静了。

c.text: Option C is not the worst because, although focusing on maintaining the current role could be useful, it doesn't completely close off the possibility of new goals, but it might limit the session to short-term strategies.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while a pre-session questionnaire can be helpful in identifying new priorities, it may not fully engage the client in real-time reflection and exploration during the session.

a.text: Preparing a session plan based solely on the client’s previous goals assumes their focus has not shifted, which may no longer be relevant after their promotion. This approach does not align with the ICF competency 'Maintains Presence', as it risks making assumptions about the client’s current needs rather than co-creating the session based on their evolving goals.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements' and 'Evokes Awareness'. By congratulating the client and then inquiring about new goals or directions, you acknowledge their achievement and create space for them to define the next phase of their career aspirations. This fosters client autonomy and supports the evolution of their goals, ensuring that the coaching remains relevant to their current situation.

options.text: Prepare a session plan based on the client’s previous goals, assuming they will want to continue building on the same trajectory.
Begin the session by congratulating the client on their promotion and then inquire about any new goals or directions they may want to explore.
Shift the focus toward helping the client maintain their current role, discussing strategies for success in their new position.
Send a pre-session questionnaire to the client, asking them to outline any new goals or areas they’d like to focus on, ensuring the session is directly tailored to their current priorities.

title: As a career development coach, you are preparing for a session with a long-term client who has been working on career advancement strategies. Recently, the client has achieved a significant promotion, which was a previous goal. In your upcoming session, you want to ensure that the coaching continues to align with the client’s evolving career aspirations and personal development.

options.text: 基于客户之前的目标准备一份会谈计划，假设他们希望在相同的轨迹上继续发展。
以祝贺客户晋升作为会谈的开始，然后询问他们可能想探索的任何新目标或方向。
将焦点转移到帮助客户维持目前的角色，讨论在新职位上取得成功的策略。
向客户发送一份会前问卷，要求他们列出任何想关注的新目标或领域，确保会谈直接针对他们当前的优先事项。

title: 作为一名职业发展教练，你正在为与一位长期客户的会谈做准备，该客户一直致力于职业晋升策略。最近，该客户实现了一次重大的晋升，这曾是以前的一个目标。在即将到来的会谈中，你要确保教练辅导继续与客户不断发展的职业抱负和个人发展保持一致。

a.text: 仅基于客户之前的目标准备会谈计划，假设他们的关注点没有转移，这在他们晋升后可能不再相关。这种方法不符合ICF能力“保持在场”，因为它存在对客户当前需求做出假设的风险，而不是基于他们不断发展的目标共同创造会谈。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力“建立和维持协议”和“引起觉察”。通过祝贺客户然后询问新目标或方向，你承认了他们的成就，并为他们定义职业抱负的下一阶段创造了空间。这培养了客户的自主权并支持其目标的演变，确保教练辅导与其当前情况保持相关。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为尽管专注于维持当前角色可能是有用的，但这并没有完全关闭新目标的可能性，不过可能会将会谈限制在短期策略上。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然会前问卷有助于确定新的优先事项，但它可能无法让客户在会谈期间充分参与实时反思和探索。

options.text: Suggest a structured exercise plan aimed at general health improvement and recommend that the client prioritize fitting this into their current routine.
Explore the client’s current commitments together, helping them identify opportunities for adjustment or time reallocation to create room for regular exercise.
Recommend that the client join a gym and hire a personal trainer, as external accountability and professional support could help them commit to a consistent routine.
Focus the conversation on the overall benefits of regular exercise since reinforcing its value will motivate the client to find time for it in their schedule.

title: As a health and wellness coach, you are working with a client who has set a goal to improve their overall physical health. In your upcoming session, the client expresses a desire to focus specifically on developing a sustainable exercise routine but seems unsure about how to fit this into their already busy schedule. The client is seeking guidance on how to prioritize their commitments to make space for regular physical activity.

a.text: Option A is the worst action because it disregards Core Competency 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Facilitates Client Growth' by providing a prescriptive solution instead of partnering with the client. It bypasses the client’s role in identifying their own path forward, which can lead to a lack of ownership and lower commitment. It also violates Core Competency 'Cultivates Trust and Safety' by potentially placing pressure on the client without acknowledging their individual context.

b.text: Option B is the BEST action because it aligns with 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Facilitates Client Growth'. By partnering with the client to explore their current commitments, you support their ability to reflect and make meaningful decisions that fit their unique lifestyle. This approach honors the client’s autonomy, encourages insight, and empowers them to take ownership of their plan. It also reflects 'Cultivates Trust and Safety' by fostering a supportive, non-directive environment.

c.text: Option C is not the best because it imposes a solution rather than co-creating one with the client.

d.text: Option D is the second worst, as it leans on motivation rather than practical exploration, but at least it honors the client’s agency and avoids prescribing actions.

a.text: 选项A是最差的行动，因为它忽视了核心能力“引起觉察”和“促进客户成长”，提供了一个规定性的解决方案而不是与客户合作。它绕过了客户在确定自己前进道路中的角色，这可能导致缺乏主人翁感和低承诺度。它还违反了核心能力“培养信任与安全”，因为它可能在不承认客户个人背景的情况下给客户施加压力。

b.text: 选项B是最佳行动，因为它符合“引起觉察”和“促进客户成长”。通过与客户合作探索他们当前的承诺事项，你支持了他们反思并做出适合其独特生活方式的有意义决定的能力。这种方法尊重客户的自主权，鼓励洞察力，并赋予他们掌控自己计划的权力。它还通过培养支持性、非指导性的环境体现了“培养信任与安全”。

c.text: 选项C不是最佳选择，因为它强加了一个解决方案，而不是与客户共同创造一个解决方案。

d.text: 选项D是倒数第二差的，因为它依赖于激励而不是实际探索，但至少它尊重了客户的能动性并避免了规定行动。
