a.text: Recommending the workshop without mentioning the referral fee is the worst action because it violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.8 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 12), which requires coaches to disclose compensation or benefits received for referrals. Failing to disclose the financial benefit undermines transparency and could damage trust if the client later learns of the undisclosed referral fee.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.8 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 12), which requires coaches to disclose compensation or benefits received for referrals. By recommending the workshop and being transparent about the referral fee, you uphold ethical integrity and ensure the client can make an informed decision. Transparency about the financial arrangement maintains trust and avoids potential conflicts of interest.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because it avoids any potential conflict of interest, but it prevents the client from benefiting from a potentially valuable resource simply due to the referral fee arrangement, which could be handled ethically through full disclosure.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while refusing the referral fee maintains ethical integrity, it lacks the transparency that Option B provides, potentially leaving the client unaware of all aspects of the recommendation.

options.text: Recommend the workshop to your client without mentioning the referral fee, ensuring the focus stays on the benefits of the workshop without complicating the decision with financial details.
Recommend the workshop to your client and be transparent about the referral fee, giving them full knowledge of the situation.
Avoid recommending the workshop to your client altogether to eliminate any potential conflict of interest, focusing instead on other ways to support their team dynamics.
Recommend the workshop and refuse the referral fee to maintain complete ethical integrity.

title: You are coaching a client who is struggling with team dynamics, and based on your understanding of their needs, you believe that attending a specific team-building workshop could greatly benefit their situation. The provider of this workshop offers a referral fee to professionals who recommend their services. What is the BEST/WORST action?

options.text: 向你的客户推荐该研讨会而不提及推荐费，确保重点停留在研讨会的益处上，而不让财务细节使决定复杂化。
向你的客户推荐该研讨会并对推荐费保持透明，让他们完全了解情况。
完全避免向你的客户推荐该研讨会，以消除任何潜在的利益冲突，转而专注于其他支持其团队动态的方式。
推荐该研讨会并拒绝推荐费，以保持完全的道德操守。

title: 你正在辅导一位在团队动态方面遇到困难的客户，根据你对他们需求的了解，你认为参加一个特定的团队建设研讨会可能会极大地改善他们的情况。该研讨会的提供者向推荐其服务的专业人士提供推荐费。

a.text: 在不提及推荐费的情况下推荐研讨会是最差的行动，因为它违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.8（以及2020版准则：第1章第12条），该标准要求教练披露因推荐而获得的报酬或利益。未能披露经济利益破坏了透明度，如果客户后来得知未披露的推荐费，可能会损害信任。

b.text: 这种方法符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.8（以及2020版准则：第1章第12条），该标准要求教练披露因推荐而获得的报酬或利益。通过推荐研讨会并对推荐费保持透明，你维护了道德操守并确保客户能够做出知情决定。关于财务安排的透明度维护了信任并避免了潜在的利益冲突。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为它避免了任何潜在的利益冲突，但它仅仅因为推荐费安排而阻止了客户从潜在的有价值资源中受益，而这本可以通过充分披露以合乎道德的方式处理。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然拒绝推荐费维护了道德操守，但它缺乏选项B所提供的透明度，可能会让客户对推荐的所有方面不知情。

a.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Embodies a Coaching Mindset' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety.' Continuing to coach as usual while hoping your personal issues will resolve soon disregards the observed impact on your coaching performance and potentially compromises the quality of service you're providing to your client. This method fails to address the ethical responsibility of ensuring your client receives the level of support they deserve. It also neglects your own need for support and self-care during a challenging time. This approach risks further deterioration of the coaching relationship and could lead to negative outcomes for both you and your client.

b.text: Option B is not the worst because it attempts to address the situation openly, but it inappropriately shifts the burden of your personal issues onto the client and may make them feel responsible for accommodating your stress, which is not their role.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Embodies a Coaching Mindset' and 'Maintains Presence.' By seeking support from a mentor or supervisor, you're demonstrating professional responsibility and a commitment to maintaining the integrity of the coaching relationship. This method allows you to gain objective insights and guidance on how to handle the situation ethically and effectively. It shows respect for both your client's needs and your own well-being. Considering the possibility of suspending or terminating the coaching relationship if necessary demonstrates a willingness to prioritize the client's best interests, even if it means making difficult decisions. This approach also models the importance of seeking support and guidance when facing challenges, which is a valuable lesson for clients as well.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while it attempts to mitigate the impact of your stress, it doesn't address the root issue and may not be sufficient to ensure the quality of coaching your client deserves.

options.text: Continue coaching the client as usual, hoping that your personal issues will resolve soon and not affect your performance further.
Discuss your current situation with the client and seek their understanding while you try to manage your personal stress.
Seek support from a mentor or supervisor to determine the best course of action and consider suspending or terminating the coaching relationship if necessary.
Reduce the number of sessions with the client to minimize the impact of your personal stress on your coaching performance.

title: You have been coaching a client for several months, but recently you have been experiencing significant personal stress due to a family illness. This stress is affecting your ability to remain fully present and focused during coaching sessions. You notice that your performance is slipping and that you are not providing the level of support your client deserves. What is the BEST/WORST action?

options.text: 像往常一样继续辅导客户，希望你的个人问题很快解决，不再进一步影响你的表现。
与客户讨论你目前的情况，并在你试图管理个人压力的同时寻求他们的理解。
寻求导师或督导的支持，以确定最佳行动方案，并在必要时考虑暂停或终止教练关系。
减少与客户的会谈次数，以尽量减少你的个人压力对教练表现的影响。

title: 你辅导一位客户已经好几个月了，但最近由于家人生病，你经历了巨大的个人压力。这种压力正在影响你在教练会谈中保持完全在场和专注的能力。你注意到你的表现正在下滑，并且没有提供客户应得的支持水平。

a.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力中的‘体现教练思维’（Embodies a Coaching Mindset）和‘建立信任与安全’（Cultivates Trust and Safety）。在希望个人问题很快解决的同时像往常一样继续辅导，无视了观察到的对你教练表现的影响，并可能损害你向客户提供的服务质量。这种方法未能解决确保客户获得其应得支持水平的道德责任。它也忽视了你在困难时期对支持和自我关怀的需求。这种方法有导致教练关系进一步恶化的风险，并可能给即你和客户都带来负面结果。

b.text: 选项B不是最差的，因为它试图公开解决这种情况，但它不恰当地将你的个人问题的负担转移给了客户，并可能让他们觉得有责任迁就你的压力，而这不是他们的角色。

c.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力中的‘体现教练思维’（Embodies a Coaching Mindset）和‘保持在场’（Maintains Presence）。通过寻求导师或督导的支持，你展示了专业责任感以及维护教练关系完整性的承诺。这种方法允许你获得客观的见解和指导，以合乎道德和有效的方式处理这种情况。它显示了对客户需求和你自身福祉的尊重。考虑在必要时暂停或终止教练关系的可能性，表明了优先考虑客户最大利益的意愿，即使这意味着做出艰难的决定。这种方法还示范了在面临挑战时寻求支持和指导的重要性，这对于客户来说也是宝贵的一课。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然它试图减轻你压力的影响，但它没有解决根本问题，并且可能不足以确保客户应得的教练质量。

a.text: Option A is not the best because, while trusting your professionalism is important, it does not address the potential for unconscious bias or the ethical responsibility to disclose the conflict.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.2 (and the 2020 Code: Section 2, Standard 18), which requires coaches to disclose actual and potential conflicts of interest, and with Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements. By explaining your relationship with the consulting firm and discussing the potential conflict of interest, you ensure transparency and give the executive the opportunity to make informed decisions about how to move forward. This open conversation also allows you to establish clear boundaries, ensuring that the integrity of the coaching relationship is maintained.

c.text: This approach violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.1 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 10), which requires coaches to be aware of and address conflicts of interest by communicating them clearly to the client. By subtly steering the conversation away from the consulting firm and avoiding the issue, you are withholding relevant information that may affect the client's trust and decision-making. This also violates Core Competency 4: Cultivates Trust and Safety, which require transparency, honesty, and respect for the client's autonomy.

d.text: Option D is not the worst because while it risks overstepping by influencing the client’s decision, it at least acknowledges the connection—albeit inadequately—whereas Option C avoids it altogether.

options.text: Continue the coaching relationship as usual, trusting that your professionalism and integrity will prevent any bias from influencing the coaching.

Carefully explain to the executive that your relationship with the consulting firm could present a conflict of interest, then openly discuss possible ways to manage it, including transparency and boundaries moving forward.

Subtly steer the conversation away from the consulting firm and focus on the executive’s broader project goals, hoping to avoid addressing the potential conflict unless it becomes more relevant later.
Suggest that the executive proceed with hiring the consulting firm and assure them that you can maintain your impartiality despite the connection.

title: You are an external coach working with a senior executive of a company who is navigating significant organizational changes. Recently, the executive mentioned that they have identified a consulting firm that seems like a perfect fit for the project. As the conversation progresses, you realize that this consulting firm is closely connected to your personal life in a way that could affect the dynamics of the coaching relationship. What is the BEST/WORST action?

c.text: 这种做法违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.1（以及2020版准则：第1章第10条），该标准要求教练意识到并通过向客户清晰沟通来解决利益冲突。通过微妙地将对话从咨询公司转移开并回避该问题，你隐瞒了可能影响客户信任和决策的相关信息。这也违反了核心能力4：建立信任与安全，该能力要求透明、诚实和尊重客户的自主权。

d.text: 选项D不是最差的，因为虽然它冒着通过影响客户决定而越界的风险，但它至少承认了这种联系——尽管是不充分的——而选项C则完全回避了它。

a.text: 选项A不是最佳选择，因为虽然信任你的专业精神很重要，但它并没有解决潜在的无意识偏见问题或披露冲突的道德责任。

b.text: 这种方法符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.2（以及2020版准则：第2章第18条），该标准要求教练披露实际和潜在的利益冲突，同时也符合核心能力3：建立和维持协议。通过解释你与咨询公司的关系并讨论潜在的利益冲突，你确保了透明度，并让高管有机会就如何推进做出知情的决定。这种公开的对话也允许你建立清晰的界限，确保维护教练关系的完整性。

options.text: 像往常一样继续教练关系，相信你的专业精神和正直将防止任何偏见影响教练工作。
仔细向高管解释你与咨询公司的关系可能会带来利益冲突，然后公开讨论管理它的可能方法，包括未来的透明度和界限。
微妙地将对话从咨询公司转移开，专注于高管更广泛的项目目标，希望能避免解决潜在的冲突，除非后来变得更加相关。
建议高管继续聘用咨询公司，并向他们保证尽管有联系，你仍能保持公正。

title: 你是一名外部教练，正与一家公司的一位高级主管合作，该公司正在经历重大的组织变革。最近，这位高管提到他们已经确定了一家咨询公司，似乎非常适合这个项目。随着对话的进行，你意识到这家咨询公司与你的个人生活有密切联系，这可能会影响教练关系的动态。

a.text: Option A is not the worst because it mentions adherence to the Code of Ethics, though it still lacks sufficient detail and transparency to ensure ethical alignment with the organization.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Core Competency 'Establishes and Maintains Agreements.' By providing the HR manager with this information, you ensure that they understand the ethical standards you adhere to, which builds trust and transparency in the coaching relationship. It also helps prevent potential ethical misunderstandings and reinforces your commitment to professional conduct.

c.text: Focusing only on coaching goals and avoiding a detailed explanation of the ICF Code of Ethics unless specifically asked is the worst action because it disregards your ethical responsibility to ensure all stakeholders are informed of the standards guiding your coaching. It fails to meet Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements, which requires setting shared expectations, including ethical guidelines, with both clients and sponsors.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while it provides access to the information, it lacks the proactive engagement and explanation that ensure the HR manager fully understands the ethical framework guiding the coaching engagement.

options.text: Mention that you adhere to the ICF Code of Ethics without going into details, assuming they will trust your professionalism.
Provide the HR manager with a copy of the ICF Code of Ethics and explain the key points, including the ECR process and the ICF Pledge of Ethics.
Focus on the coaching goals and process, and only provide detailed information about the ICF Code of Ethics if they specifically ask for it.
Send the HR manager a follow-up email with a link to the ICF website, suggesting they can read the Code of Ethics if they are interested.

title: You are beginning a new coaching engagement with a large organization that has hired you to coach several of their senior managers. During the kickoff meeting, you explain the coaching process and outline the goals of the engagement. However, you realize that the company’s HR manager, who is coordinating the program, is not familiar with the ICF Code of Ethics or the Ethical Conduct Review (ECR) process. What is the WORST action?
你正在开始与一家大型组织的新教练业务，该组织聘请你为其几位高级经理进行辅导。在启动会议上，你解释了教练流程并概述了业务目标。然而，你意识到负责协调该项目的公司人力资源经理并不熟悉《ICF道德准则》或道德行为审查（ECR）流程。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然它提供了信息的访问途径，但它缺乏确保人力资源经理充分理解指导教练业务的道德框架所需的主动参与和解释。

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为它提到了遵守道德准则，尽管它仍然缺乏足够的细节和透明度来确保与组织的道德一致性。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力‘建立和维持协议’（Establishes and Maintains Agreements）。通过向人力资源经理提供这些信息，你确保他们理解你所遵守的道德标准，这在教练关系中建立了信任和透明度。这也有助于防止潜在的道德误解，并加强你对职业行为的承诺。

c.text: 只关注教练目标而避免详细解释ICF道德准则（除非被特别问及）是最差的行动，因为它忽视了你的道德责任，即确保所有利益相关者都了解指导你教练工作的标准。它未能满足核心能力3：建立和维持协议，该能力要求与客户和赞助商设定共同的期望，包括道德准则。

options.text: 提及你遵守《ICF道德准则》但不深入细节，假设他们会信任你的专业精神。
向人力资源经理提供一份《ICF道德准则》副本并解释关键点，包括ECR流程和ICF道德誓言。
专注于教练目标和流程，只有在他们特别询问时才提供关于《ICF道德准则》的详细信息。
给人力资源经理发送一封后续邮件，附上ICF网站的链接，建议他们如果有兴趣可以阅读道德准则。
Continue using the AI tool without informing clients, since it only enhances the coaching process and does not replace human coaching.
Disclose to clients that AI is being used in their sessions and obtain their consent before integrating it into the coaching process.
Stop using the AI tool altogether, as coaching should be purely human-driven to maintain professional integrity.
Use AI-generated suggestions but modify them slightly to align with the coach’s personal style, avoiding the need for disclosure.

title: You begin integrating an AI-driven platform into your coaching practice. The system analyzes client responses and suggests coaching questions, which you use to enhance sessions. What is the WORST action?

a.text: Option A is the WORST action because it violates ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 2.5 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 7), which requires transparency about the tools and methods used in coaching, including AI. Failing to disclose the AI’s involvement denies clients the opportunity to provide informed consent and undermines the trust in the coaching agreement. This also conflicts with Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements.

b.text: Option B is the BEST action because it aligns with ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 2.5 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 7), which requires coaches to ethically manage technology used in coaching. It also supports Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements, by ensuring that clients are fully informed and give explicit consent to the use of AI in their coaching process. This promotes trust, autonomy, and transparency.

c.text: Option C is the second best, as it eliminates ethical risk entirely, but may limit useful tools unnecessarily if they can be used responsibly with disclosure.

d.text: Option D is the second worst, as it attempts to obscure AI involvement through indirect use, still bypassing the need for disclosure and informed client choice.

a.text: 选项A是最差的行动，因为它违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准2.5（以及2020版准则：第1章第7条），该标准要求对教练中使用的工具和方法（包括AI）保持透明。未能披露AI的参与剥夺了客户提供知情同意的机会，并破坏了教练协议中的信任。这也与核心能力3：建立和维持协议相冲突。

b.text: 选项B是最佳行动，因为它符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准2.5（以及2020版准则：第1章第7条），该标准要求教练合乎道德地管理教练中使用的技术。它还支持核心能力3：建立和维持协议，通过确保客户完全知情并明确同意在其教练过程中使用AI。这促进了信任、自主和透明度。

c.text: 选项C是第二好的选择，因为它完全消除了道德风险，但如果这些工具可以在披露的情况下负责任地使用，这样做可能会不必要地限制有用的工具。

d.text: 选项D是第二差的，因为它试图通过间接使用来掩盖AI的参与，仍然绕过了披露和客户知情选择的需要。

options.text: 继续使用AI工具而不通知客户，因为它只是增强了教练过程，并没有取代人工教练。
向客户披露在会谈中使用了AI，并在将其整合到教练过程之前获得他们的同意。
完全停止使用AI工具，因为教练应该是纯粹由人驱动的，以维护职业诚信。
使用AI生成的建议，但稍微修改以符合教练的个人风格，从而避免披露的需要。

title: 你开始将一个AI驱动的平台整合到你的教练实践中。该系统分析客户的回答并建议教练问题，你利用这些问题来增强会谈。

a.text: Option A is not the worst because it acknowledges the emotions, but it prematurely moves to problem-solving without allowing space for emotional processing, which could be important for the client's overall progress.

b.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Maintains Presence' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety.' By sharing your observations and offering the client a choice to pause or explore their feelings, you're demonstrating attentiveness to their emotional state while respecting their autonomy. This method creates a safe space for the client to process their emotions if they choose to, or to take a moment to recompose if needed. It shows empathy and flexibility in the coaching process, adapting to the client's immediate needs. This approach can lead to deeper insights and a stronger coaching relationship by addressing the emotional aspect of the client's experience.

c.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Listens Actively' and 'Evokes Awareness.' Suggesting a shift away from the emotional topic to help the client regain composure fails to honor the significance of the emotions present and could be perceived as dismissive of the client's experience. This method misses a crucial opportunity for the client to gain awareness and insights from their emotional response to the setback. It may inadvertently signal that expressing emotions is inappropriate or unproductive in the coaching context, potentially hindering open and honest communication in future sessions.

d.text: Option D is not the best because, while it allows the client to manage their emotions independently, it misses an opportunity to actively support the client and potentially explore valuable emotional insights.

options.text: Acknowledge the client’s emotions briefly and encourage them to continue discussing strategies to overcome their setback.
Share what you are observing and ask if they would like to pause the conversation or explore the feelings coming up for them.
Suggest shifting the focus away from the emotional topic and onto a more neutral area of discussion to help the client regain composure.
Wait for the client to compose themselves, allowing them to manage their emotions independently without interrupting the flow of the session.

title: During a coaching session, your client becomes visibly emotional while discussing a recent setback at work. Their voice starts to shake, and they begin to tear up as they describe feeling overwhelmed and questioning their abilities. Despite the intense emotions, the client continues speaking and trying to move forward with the session. What is the BEST/WORST action?

a.text: 选项A不是最差的，因为它承认了情绪，但它过早地转向解决问题，没有给情绪处理留出空间，而这对客户的整体进步可能很重要。

b.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力中的‘保持在场’（Maintains Presence）和‘建立信任与安全’（Cultivates Trust and Safety）。通过分享你的观察并提供客户暂停或探索感受的选择，你既展示了对他们情绪状态的关注，又尊重了他们的自主权。这种方法为客户创造了一个安全空间，如果他们愿意，可以处理情绪，或者在需要时花点时间恢复。这显示了教练过程中的同理心和灵活性，适应了客户的即时需求。通过解决客户体验中的情绪层面，这种方法可以带来更深层的见解和更牢固的教练关系。

c.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力中的‘积极倾听’（Listens Actively）和‘引起觉察’（Evokes Awareness）。建议转移情绪话题以帮助客户恢复镇定，未能尊重当前情绪的重要性，并可能被视为对客户体验的轻视。这种方法错失了让客户从对挫折的情绪反应中获得觉察和见解的关键机会。它可能无意中发出信号，暗示在教练情境中表达情绪是不恰当的或非生产性的，可能会阻碍未来会谈中的坦诚沟通。

d.text: 选项D不是最佳选择，因为虽然它允许客户独立管理情绪，但它错失了积极支持客户并可能探索有价值情绪见解的机会。

options.text: 简要承认客户的情绪，并鼓励他们继续讨论克服挫折的策略。
分享你观察到的情况，并询问他们是否愿意暂停对话或探索涌上心头的感觉。
建议将焦点从情绪话题转移到更中立的讨论领域，以帮助客户恢复镇定。
等待客户自己平复情绪，允许他们独立管理情绪，而不打断会谈的流程。

title: 在一次教练会谈中，当讨论工作中的最近一次挫折时，你的客户变得明显情绪化。他们的声音开始颤抖，并且当他们描述感到不知所措和质疑自己的能力时，他们开始流泪。尽管情绪激烈，客户仍在继续说话并试图推进会谈。

a.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Facilitates Client Growth.' By asking the client to consider how their current efforts might be building skills and relationships for future opportunities, you're encouraging them to shift their perspective and see potential value in their current situation. This method challenges the client's limiting belief that their efforts are pointless, without dismissing their feelings of frustration. It invites the client to explore a broader view of their career development, potentially uncovering insights or opportunities they hadn't previously considered. This approach can help the client move from a fixed mindset to a growth mindset, which is crucial for overcoming career challenges.

b.text: Option B is not the best because, while exploring frustrations can be valuable, it risks reinforcing the client's current negative perspective without offering a pathway to new insights or solutions.

c.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Maintains Presence' and 'Facilitates Client Growth.' Suggesting that the client take a break from focusing on career goals avoids addressing the core issue and may reinforce the client's belief that their efforts are futile. This method doesn't challenge the client's limiting beliefs or help them explore new perspectives on their situation. It could lead to further stagnation in their career and missed opportunities for growth and development. This approach also fails to leverage the client's current frustration as a potential catalyst for change and personal growth.

d.text: Option D is not the worst because validating the client's feelings can be important for building trust, but it doesn't actively help the client move beyond their current perspective or explore new possibilities for their career development.

options.text: Ask the client if they have considered how their current efforts might be building skills and relationships that could lead to future opportunities, offering a broader perspective on the situation.
Encourage the client to express more details about why they feel their efforts have gone unnoticed, focusing on the specifics of their frustrations.
Suggest that the client take a break from focusing on career goals for a while to reduce their frustration and pressure.
Validate the client's feelings of frustration and acknowledge that it's understandable to feel that way in such situations.

title: Your client has been feeling stuck in their career, repeatedly mentioning how they've been passed over for promotions. They express frustration, saying that their efforts at work seem to go unnoticed and that there's no point in trying any harder because 'it's just not worth it.' You sense that the client's current perspective may be limiting their ability to see other possibilities or opportunities for growth in their situation. What is the BEST/WORST action?

a.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力中的‘引起觉察’（Evokes Awareness）和‘促进客户成长’（Facilitates Client Growth）。通过询问客户是否考虑过目前的努力可能正在建立技能和关系，从而带来未来的机会，你正在鼓励他们转变视角，看到目前情况下的潜在价值。这种方法挑战了客户关于努力毫无意义的限制性信念，同时也没有忽视他们的挫折感。它邀请客户探索更广阔的职业发展观，可能会揭示他们以前未考虑过的见解或机会。这种方法可以帮助客户从固定型思维转向成长型思维，这对于克服职业挑战至关重要。

b.text: 选项B不是最佳选择，因为虽然探索挫折感可能是有价值的，但它有强化客户当前消极视角的风险，而没有提供通往新见解或解决方案的途径。

c.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力中的‘保持在场’（Maintains Presence）和‘促进客户成长’（Facilitates Client Growth）。建议客户暂停关注职业目标回避了核心问题，并可能强化客户认为努力徒劳的信念。这种方法没有挑战客户的限制性信念，也没有帮助他们探索对情况的新视角。这可能导致他们的职业生涯进一步停滞，并错失成长和发展的机会。这种方法也未能利用客户当前的挫折感作为改变和个人成长的潜在催化剂。

d.text: 选项D不是最差的，因为认可客户的感受对于建立信任很重要，但它没有积极帮助客户超越当前的视角或探索职业发展的新可能性。

options.text: 询问客户是否考虑过他们的努力可能正在建立技能和关系，从而带来未来的机会，为情况提供更广阔的视角。
鼓励客户表达更多关于为什么觉得努力被忽视的细节，专注于他们沮丧的具体细节。
建议客户暂时停止关注职业目标，以减少他们的挫折感和压力。
认可客户的挫折感，并承认在这种情况下的这种感觉是可以理解的。

title: 你的客户感到事业停滞不前，反复提到他们如何错过晋升。他们表达了沮丧，说他们在工作中的努力似乎被忽视了，再努力也没用，因为‘这不值得’。你感觉到客户目前的视角可能限制了他们看到这种情况下其他可能性或成长机会的能力。

a.text: Option A is not the best because, while creating an action plan can be helpful, it may be premature without first exploring the broader context and available resources, and could potentially increase the client's feeling of being overwhelmed.

b.text: This approach does not align with the ICF competencies of 'Maintains Presence' and 'Cultivates Trust and Safety.' Encouraging the client to push through their anxiety and take immediate action without proper planning or support can be counterproductive and potentially harmful. This method dismisses the client's valid concerns and anxiety, and it fails to address the root causes of their overwhelm. It could lead to hasty decisions or actions that may compound the project's complexity and the client's stress levels. This approach also misses an opportunity to help the client develop important skills in project management and emotional regulation.

c.text: Option C is not the worst because acknowledging that feeling overwhelmed is normal can be reassuring, but it doesn't provide the client with the tools or strategies they need to effectively manage their project and anxiety.

d.text: This approach aligns with the ICF core competencies of 'Evokes Awareness' and 'Facilitates Client Growth.' By asking the client to reflect on available support and resources while also considering potential challenges, you're encouraging a balanced and proactive approach to problem-solving. This method helps the client to step back and assess their situation more holistically, potentially uncovering resources or strategies they hadn't considered. It acknowledges the complexity of the situation without dismissing the client's anxiety, and it empowers them to take ownership of finding solutions. This approach can lead to increased confidence and a more strategic mindset in tackling the project.

options.text: Suggest that the client create a detailed action plan, listing all tasks that need to be completed in the upcoming weeks.
Encourage the client to push through the anxiety and take immediate action, trusting that they will figure out the details along the way.
Reassure the client that feeling overwhelmed is normal, and encourage them to simply take it one day at a time without overthinking the process.
Ask the client to reflect on what support and resources are available to help them move forward, while also identifying potential challenges they might encounter.

title: Your client has been working on a long-term project at work, but they are starting to feel overwhelmed by the growing complexity and number of tasks involved. They express concern about meeting deadlines and mention that they haven’t thought about how to organize the next steps. The client is highly motivated to succeed, but their anxiety is preventing them from making clear progress. What is the BEST/WORST action?

options.text: 建议客户制定详细的行动计划，列出未来几周需要完成的所有任务。
鼓励客户克服焦虑并立即采取行动，相信他们会在过程中弄清楚细节。
向客户保证感到不知所措是正常的，并鼓励他们只关注当下，不要过度思考整个过程。
要求客户反思有哪些支持和资源可以帮助他们前进，同时也识别他们可能遇到的潜在挑战。

title: 你的客户一直在处理工作中一个长期的项目，但面对日益增加的复杂性和任务数量，他们开始感到不知所措。他们表达了对能否按时完成任务的担忧，并提到他们还没有考虑如何组织下一步。客户非常有动力想要成功，但他们的焦虑阻碍了他们取得明显的进展。

b.text: 这种方法不符合ICF能力中的‘保持在场’（Maintains Presence）和‘建立信任与安全’（Cultivates Trust and Safety）。鼓励客户克服焦虑并立即采取行动，而没有适当的计划或支持，可能会适得其反，甚至可能有害。这种方法无视了客户合理的担忧和焦虑，也未能解决他们感到不知所措的根本原因。这可能会导致草率的决定或行动，从而加剧项目的复杂性和客户的压力水平。这种方法也错失了帮助客户发展项目管理和情绪调节等重要技能的机会。

c.text: 选项C不是最差的，因为承认感到不知所措是正常的可以起到安抚作用，但它并没有为客户提供他们有效管理项目和焦虑所需的工具或策略。

d.text: 这种方法符合ICF核心能力中的‘引起觉察’（Evokes Awareness）和‘促进客户成长’（Facilitates Client Growth）。通过询问客户反思可用的支持和资源，同时考虑潜在的挑战，你正在鼓励一种平衡和主动的问题解决方法。这种方法帮助客户退后一步，更全面地评估他们的情况，可能会发现他们未曾考虑过的资源或策略。它承认了情况的复杂性，同时也并未忽视客户的焦虑，并赋予他们寻找解决方案的主动权。这种方法可以在处理项目时带来增强的信心和更具战略性的思维模式。

a.text: 选项A不是最佳选择，因为虽然制定行动计划可能有帮助，但在没有先探索更广泛的背景和可用资源的情况下，这可能为时过早，并且可能会潜在地增加客户的不知所措感。

title: You have been coaching a client for several months. Lately, the client has started offering personal compliments, expressing deep appreciation beyond the coaching context, and occasionally inviting you to meet outside of sessions. You sense they may be developing romantic feelings. What is the BEST/WORST approach to take?

a.text: Option A is the WORST action because it ignores subtle but important shifts in the relationship dynamic, violating ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.6 (and the 2020 Code: Section 3, Standard 24). Failing to acknowledge the client’s behavior allows ethical boundaries to blur, risking a breach of trust. It also contradicts Core Competency 4: Cultivates Trust and Safety, which emphasizes creating clarity and psychological safety in the coaching relationship.

b.text: Option B is the BEST action because it aligns with ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 3.6 (and the 2020 Code: Section 3, Standard 24), which requires coaches to manage boundaries and take action if intimacy or romantic interest arises. Having an open, respectful conversation ensures clarity, protects the integrity of the coaching relationship, and preserves client trust. It also supports Core Competency 4: Cultivates Trust and Safety, by maintaining a safe, professional environment.

c.text: Option C is the second best, as ending the engagement might be necessary in some cases, but it should come after attempting to address the issue directly.

d.text: Option D is the second worst because it alters the coach’s approach without transparency, which may confuse the client and damage rapport without resolving the underlying issue.

options.text: Maintain professional boundaries and ignore the client’s behavior unless they explicitly express romantic interest.
Acknowledge the shift in the relationship dynamic and have a direct conversation with the client to clarify professional boundaries.
Immediately terminate the coaching engagement to avoid any possibility of ethical concerns.
Continue coaching as usual but subtly reduce warmth and friendliness to discourage further romantic interest.

a.text: 选项A是最差的行动，因为它忽略了关系动态中微妙但重要的变化，违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.6（以及2020版准则：第3章第24条）。未能确认客户的行为会让道德界限变得模糊，有违背信任的风险。这也与核心能力4：建立信任与安全相矛盾，该能力强调在教练关系中建立清晰度和心理安全。

b.text: 选项B是最佳行动，因为它符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准3.6（以及2020版准则：第3章第24条），该标准要求教练管理界限，并在出现亲密关系或浪漫兴趣时采取行动。进行公开、尊重的对话可以确保清晰度，保护教练关系的完整性，并维护客户的信任。它还通过维护安全、专业的环境来支持核心能力4：建立信任与安全。

c.text: 选项C是第二好的选择，因为在某些情况下结束业务可能是必要的，但这应该在尝试直接解决问题之后进行。

d.text: 选项D是第二差的，因为它在不透明的情况下改变了教练的方法，这可能会使客户困惑并损害融洽关系，而没有解决根本问题。

options.text: 维持职业界限并忽略客户的行为，除非他们明确表达浪漫兴趣。
承认关系动态的转变，并与客户进行直接对话以澄清职业界限。
立即终止教练业务，以避免任何可能的道德问题。
像往常一样继续辅导，但微妙地减少热情和友好度，以劝阻进一步的浪漫兴趣。

title: 你已经辅导一位客户好几个月了。最近，客户开始给予个人赞美，表达超出教练背景的深深感激，并偶尔邀请你在会谈之外见面。你感觉到他们可能正在产生浪漫情感。

d.text: Providing HR with specific updates on the client’s progress without fully clarifying with the client what will be shared is the worst action because it compromises confidentiality and breaches the trust established in the coaching relationship. This violates the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 2.1 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 3), which requires maintaining the strictest level of confidentiality unless otherwise agreed upon. It also fails to uphold Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements, which emphasizes clarity and integrity in setting shared expectations.

a.text: Option A is not the best because, although it clarifies confidentiality limits with the client, it may not fully address the company’s needs or lead to a collaborative agreement between all stakeholders.

b.text: Option B is not the worst because it protects the client’s confidentiality, but it risks not fully meeting the company’s expectations without establishing clearer agreements upfront.

c.text: This approach aligns with the ICF Code of Ethics (2025) Standard 1.1 (and the 2020 Code: Section 1, Standard 1) and Core Competency 3: Establishes and Maintains Agreements. By exploring the client’s concerns around confidentiality and then arranging a follow-up meeting with HR, you take a proactive step toward balancing both parties’ needs. This ensures that an agreement is reached about what can be shared without compromising the coaching relationship, fostering transparency and trust.

options.text: Discuss with the client the limits of confidentiality and clarify what information will and won’t be shared with HR, ensuring both parties’ expectations are met.
Acknowledge the client’s need for confidentiality and propose not sharing any session details with HR while offering general progress reports to meet the company’s expectations.

Explore the client’s concerns around confidentiality at the start and then arrange a follow-up meeting with HR to reach an agreement on what can be shared without compromising the coaching relationship.

Clarify with the client that you will keep the coaching content confidential while providing HR with specific updates on the progress being made, balancing both the client’s privacy and the company’s goals.

title: You’ve been hired by a company to coach a senior manager who is struggling with time management and team dynamics. The company’s HR director expressed specific expectations for the coaching, including regular progress updates on the client’s performance. However, during your first session with the client, they emphasize their need for confidentiality and prefer that you do not share details of the sessions with HR. What is the BEST/WORST action?

d.text: 在没有与客户完全阐明将分享什么内容的情况下向人力资源部门提供关于客户进度的具体更新是最差的行动，因为它损害了保密性并破坏了在教练关系中建立的信任。这违反了《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准2.1（以及2020版准则：第1章第3条），该标准要求除非另有约定，否则保持最严格的保密性。它也未能遵守核心能力3：建立和维持协议，该能力强调在设定共同期望时的清晰度和正直性。

a.text: 选项A不是最佳选择，因为虽然它与客户阐明了保密限制，但它可能无法完全解决公司的需求，也无法促成所有利益相关者之间的协作协议。

b.text: 选项B不是最差的，因为它保护了客户的保密性，但存在在未预先建立更清晰协议的情况下无法完全满足公司期望的风险。

c.text: 这种方法符合《ICF道德准则（2025版）》标准1.1（以及2020版准则：第1章第1条）和核心能力3：建立和维持协议。通过探索客户关于保密性的担忧，然后安排与人力资源部门的后续会议，你采取了主动步骤来平衡双方的需求。这确保了在不损害教练关系的情况下就可分享的内容达成协议，促进了透明度和信任。

options.text: 与客户讨论保密性的局限性，并阐明哪些信息将与人力资源部门分享，哪些不会，确保满足双方的期望。
承认客户对保密性的需求，并提议不与人力资源部门分享任何会谈细节，同时提供一般性的进度报告以满足公司的期望。

与客户阐明你将对教练内容保密，同时向人力资源部门提供关于所取得进展的具体更新，以此平衡客户的隐私和公司的目标。

title: 你被一家公司聘请辅导一位在时间管理和团队动态方面遇到困难的高级经理。该公司的人力资源总监对辅导表达了具体的期望，包括定期更新客户的绩效进度。然而，在你与客户的第一次会谈中，他们强调了对保密性的需求，并希望你不要与人力资源部门分享会谈的细节。
